  9368                                  
  9369                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9370                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9371                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9372                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9373                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9374                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9375                                  
  9376                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
  9377 000004DF E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
  9378 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9379 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9380                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9381 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9382                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9383 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9384                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9385                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9386 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9387                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9388 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9389                                  					; fnon_removable
  9390 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9391 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9392 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9393                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9394                                  
  9395                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9396                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9397 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9398 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9399                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9400 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
  9401                                  
  9402                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9403                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9404                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9405                                  
  9406 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9407 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9408 00000512 E8AB12                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9409 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9410 00000517 E80314                  		call	haschange
  9411 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9412                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9413                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9414                                  			
  9415 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9416 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9417 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9418                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9419 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9420 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
  9421 0000052B EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
  9422                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9423                                  
  9424                                  Media_Unk:				
  9425 0000052D 4E                      		dec	si		; ; Return "I don't know"
  9426                                  
  9427                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
  9428                                  		; Clean up the left overs
  9429                                  Media_Done:	
  9430                                  		; 19/10/2022			
  9431 0000052E 06                      		push	es
  9432 0000052F C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  9433 00000533 2689770E                		mov	[es:bx+0Eh], si	; [es:bx+trans]
  9434 00000537 07                      		pop	es
  9435 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si
  9436 0000053A 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
  9437 0000053C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9438 00000541 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
  9439 00000543 E86313                  		call	media_set_vid
  9440                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:			
  9441 00000546 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9442                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
  9443                                  ret_carry_clear:			
  9444 0000054B F8                      		clc			; volidok
  9445 0000054C C3                      		retn
  9446                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9447                                  
  9448                                  err_exitj:				
  9449 0000054D E88006                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
  9450                                  ret81:					
  9451 00000550 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
  9452 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9453                                  
  9454                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9455                                  
  9456                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9457                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9458                                  ; drive.
  9459                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9460                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9461                                  ; returns in si:
  9462                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9463                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9464                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9465                                  ;
  9466                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9467                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9468                                  
  9469                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9470                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9471 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9472 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9473 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9474                                  					; get stored time
  9475 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9476 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9477 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9478 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9479 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9480 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9481 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9482 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9483                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9484 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9485 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9486 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9487                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9488                                  
  9489                                  timepassed:				
  9490 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9491                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9492 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9493                                  
  9494                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9495                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9496 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9497                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9498 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9499                                  
  9500                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9501                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9502                                  Err_Exitj2:

  9505                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9506                                  
  9507                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9508                                  
  9509                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9510                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.
  9511                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9512                                  
  9513                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9514                                  get_bpb:				; 2C7h:592h = 70h:2B02h

  9518                                  					; fnon_removable

  9520

  9522                                  		; filesys_id in bds table

  9526 00000595 C606[0A05]01            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 1
  9527 0000059A E85A00                  		call	GetBp		; build	a bpb if necessary
  9528 0000059D 72B1                    		jb	short ret81
  9529                                  		;cmp	ds:set_id_flag,	2 ; already, volume_label set from boot
  9530 0000059F 803E[0A05]02            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 2
  9531                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 ; record to bds table?
  9532 000005A4 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9533 000005A9 740A                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; do not set it again from	root dir
  9534                                  					; otherwise, conventional boot record
  9535                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	; do we	have changeline	support?
  9536 000005AB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9537 000005B0 7403                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; brif not
  9538 000005B2 E86E13                  		call	set_volume_id
  9539                                  already_gotbpb:				
  9540 000005B5 83C706                  		add	di, 6		; BDS.BPB
  9541                                  					; return the bpb from the current bds
  9542                                  
  9543                                  ;		 fall into setptrsav, es:di -> result
  9544                                  
  9545                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9546                                  
  9547                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9548                                  
  9549                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9550                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
  9551                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
  9552                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
  9553                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
  9554                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data. 
  9555                                  ;NB: It is fine to corrupt cx because this is not a return value and anyway
  9556                                  ;this returns to Chardev_entry (msbio1.asm) where all registers are 
  9557                                  ;restored before returning to the caller.
  9558                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9559                                  
  9560                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9561                                  SetPtrSav:	; return point for dsk_init

  9575                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
  9576                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
  9577                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table

  9579                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
  9580                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.

  9628                                  
  9629                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9630                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9631                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9632                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9633                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9634                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9635                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9636                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9637                                  ;
  9638                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9639                                  ;
  9640                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9641                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9642                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9643                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9644                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9645                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9646                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9647                                  ;
  9648                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9649                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9650                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9651                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9652                                  
  9653                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9654                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9655 000005F7 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
  9656 000005FC 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
  9657 000005FE E99500                  		jmp	getret_exit
  9658                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9659                                  
  9660                                  getbp1:					
  9661 00000601 51                      		push	cx
  9662 00000602 52                      		push	dx
  9663 00000603 53                      		push	bx
  9664                                  
  9665                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
  9666                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
  9667                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
  9668                                  
  9669 00000604 E8A400                  		call	readbootsec
  9670 00000607 7209                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.
  9671 00000609 09DB                    		or	bx, bx		; bx is	0 if boot sector is valid.
  9672 0000060B 7508                    		jnz	short dofatbpb
  9673 0000060D E8F000                  		call	movbpb		; move bpb into	registers
  9674 00000610 EB57                    		jmp	short Has1
  9675                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9676                                  
  9677                                  getbp_err_ret_brdg:			
  9678 00000612 E98200                  		jmp	getbp_err_ret
  9679                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9680                                  
  9681                                  		; we have a 1.x diskette. In this case read in the fat ID byte
  9682                                  		; and fill in bpb from there.
  9683                                  dofatbpb:				
  9684 00000615 E85401                  		call	readfat		; puts media descriptor	byte in	ah
  9685 00000618 72F8                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg
  9686                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	;  changeline support available?
  9687 0000061A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; 19/10/2022
  9688 0000061F 7403                    		jz	short bpb_nochangeline ; brif not
  9689 00000621 E89A12                  		call	hidensity	; may not return! May add sp, 2	and
  9690                                  					; jump to has1!!!!!! or	has720K
  9691                                  bpb_nochangeline:		; test for a valid 3.5" medium

  9693                                  					; ffSmall
  9694 00000629 7515                    		jnz	short is_floppy
  9695 0000062B 80FCF9                  		cmp	ah, 0F9h	; is it	a valid	fat id byte for	3.5" ?
  9696 0000062E 7571                    		jnz	short got_unknown_medium
  9697                                  Has720K:				
  9698                                  		;mov	bx, offset sm92 ; pointer to correct bpb
  9699 00000630 BB[DE04]                		mov	bx, sm92	; 19/10/2022
  9700                                  
  9701                                  		; es points to segment of bds. the following should be modified
  9702                                  		; to get spf,csec,spau,spt correctly. it had been wrong if
  9703                                  		; driver.sys is loaded since the bds is inside the driver.sys.
  9704

  9713                                  		;db	8Ah, 87h, 0, 0	; mov al, [bx+0]

  9752 00000681 26885515                		mov	[es:di+15h], dl	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
  9753                                  
  9754                                  		; the BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS+2 field and the
  9755                                  		; BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS field need to be set
  9756                                  		; to 0 since this code is for floppies
  9757                                  
  9758                                  		; 18/12/2022
  9759                                  		;mov	word [es:di+19h], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  9760                                  		;mov	word [es:di+17h], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  9761                                  		;mov	word [es:di+1Dh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  9762                                  		; 18/12/2022
  9763 00000685 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx
  9764 00000687 26894D19                		mov	[es:di+19h], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  9765 0000068B 26894D17                		mov	[es:di+17h], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  9766 0000068F 26894D1D                		mov	[es:di+1Dh], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  9767                                  getret:					
  9768 00000693 5B                      		pop	bx
  9769 00000694 5A                      		pop	dx
  9770 00000695 59                      		pop	cx
  9771                                  getret_exit:				
  9772 00000696 C3                      		retn
  9773                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9774                                  
  9775                                  getbp_err_ret:	; before doing anything else, set set_id_flag	to 0.			
  9776                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0
  9777                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9778 00000697 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9779 0000069C E83105                  		call	maperror
  9780 0000069F EBF2                    		jmp	short getret
  9781                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9782                                  
  9783                                  		; we have a 3.5" diskette for	which we cannot	build a	bpb.
  9784                                  		; we do	not assume any type of bpb for this medium.
  9785                                  
  9786                                  got_unknown_medium:			
  9787                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 
  9788 000006A1 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9789 000006A6 B007                    		mov	al, 7
  9790 000006A8 F9                      		stc
  9791 000006A9 EBE8                    		jmp	short getret
  9792                                  
  9793                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9794                                  
  9795                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9796                                  
  9797                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9798                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9799                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9800                                  ;
  9801                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9802                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9803                                  
  9804                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9805                                  
  9806                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
  9807                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
  9808                                  
  9809                                  readbootsec:	
  9810 000006AB B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9811 000006AD B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9812 000006B0 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9813 000006B3 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9814 000006B5 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9815                                  
  9816                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9817                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9818                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9819                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9820                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9821                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9822                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9823                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9824                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9825                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9826                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9827                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9828                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9829                                  		; informations
  9830                                  
  9831                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9832                                  
  9833                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9834 000006B7 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9835 000006BC 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9836 000006BE 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9837 000006C3 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9838 000006C5 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9839 000006CA 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9840 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9841 000006D1 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9842                                  
  9843                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9844                                  ;
  9845                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9846                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9847                                  ;;
  9848                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9849                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9850                                  ;;
  9851                                  ;;check_signature:
  9852                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9853                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9854                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9855                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9856                                  
  9857                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9858                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9859                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9860                                  
  9861                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9862                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9863 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9864                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9865 000006D6 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9866 000006D8 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9867 000006DA 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9868                                  
  9869                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9870                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9871                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9872                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9873                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9874                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9875                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9876                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9877                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9878                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9879                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9880                                  
  9881                                  checksinglesided:
  9882 000006DC A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9883 000006DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9884 000006E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9885 000006E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9886 000006E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9887 000006E7 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9888 000006ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9889 000006EF 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9890 000006F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9891                                  
  9892                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9893                                  
  9894                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9895 000006F6 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9896                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9897 000006FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9898                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9899                                  
  9900                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9901 000006FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9902                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9903                                  movbpb_ret:
  9904                                  gooddsk:				
  9905 000006FE F8                      		clc
  9906                                  err_ret:
  9907 000006FF C3                      		retn
  9908                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9909                                  
  9910                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9911                                  ;err_ret:				
  9912                                  		;retn
  9913                                  
  9914                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9915                                  
  9916                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9917                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9918                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
  9919                                  ; getbp routine at has1
  9920                                  ;
  9921                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
  9922                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
  9923                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
  9924                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
  9925                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
  9926                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
  9927                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9928                                  
  9929                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9930                                  
  9931                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9932                                  movbpb:	
  9933 00000700 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
  9934                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9935                                  					; sectors per unit
  9936 00000704 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
  9937                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  9938                                  					; number of directory entries
  9939 00000708 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
  9940                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  9941                                  					; size of drive
  9942 0000070C 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
  9943                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9944                                  					; media	descriptor
  9945 00000710 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
  9946                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  9947                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9948 00000713 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
  9949                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
  9950                                  					; sectors per track
  9951 00000717 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
  9952                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
  9953                                  					; number of heads
  9954 0000071B 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
  9955 00000720 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9956 00000722 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
  9957 00000725 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
  9958 00000727 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
  9959                                  movbpb_conv:				
  9960 0000072C 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
  9961 00000731 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9962 00000733 E8E111                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
  9963                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9964                                  		; cf = 0
  9965                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
  9966                                  		;clc
  9967 00000736 C3                      		retn
  9968                                  
  9969                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9970                                  
  9971                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
  9972                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
  9973                                  ;by es:di.
  9974                                  
  9975                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
  9976                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
  9977                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
  9978                                  ;      the boot record information.
  9979                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
  9980                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
  9981                                  
  9982                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9983                                  mov_media_ids:		
  9984 00000737 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
  9985                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
  9986                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
  9987 0000073C 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
  9988 0000073E 51                      		push	cx
  9989 0000073F 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
  9990                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
  9991 00000743 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9992 00000747 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
  9993                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
  9994 0000074B 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
  9995 0000074F 57                      		push	di
  9996 00000750 56                      		push	si
  9997 00000751 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9998 00000754 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
  9999                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10000                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10001 00000757 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10002 0000075A F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10003                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10004                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10005 0000075C B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10006 0000075E BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10007                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10008 00000761 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10009 00000764 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10010 00000766 5E                      		pop	si
 10011 00000767 5F                      		pop	di
 10012 00000768 59                      		pop	cx
 10013                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10014                                  		; cf = 0
 10015                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10016                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10017 00000769 C3                      		retn
 10018                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10019                                  
 10020                                  mmi_not_ext:				
 10021 0000076A F9                      		stc
 10022 0000076B C3                      		retn
 10023                                  
 10024                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10025                                  
 10026                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10027                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10028                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10029                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10030                                  ; output:
 10031                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10032                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10033                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10034                                  
 10035                                  readfat:	
 10036                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10037                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10038 0000076C 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10039 0000076E B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10040                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10041 00000771 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10042 00000774 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10043 00000776 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10044                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10045 00000778 C3                      		retn
 10046                                  
 10047                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10048                                  
 10049                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10050                                  
 10051                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10052                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10053                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10054                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10055                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10056                                  ;		dh has head
 10057                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10058                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10059                                  ;
 10060                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10061                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10062                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10063                                  ;
 10064                                  ;		carry set
 10065                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10066                                  ;
 10067                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10068                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10069                                  
 10070                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10071                                  
 10072                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10073                                  read_sector:	
 10074 00000779 55                      		push	bp
 10075 0000077A BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10076 0000077D 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10077 00000781 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10078                                  rd_ret:					
 10079 00000784 06                      		push	es
 10080 00000785 1E                      		push	ds
 10081 00000786 07                      		pop	es
 10082 00000787 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10083 0000078A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10084                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10085                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10086                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10087 0000078C 07                      		pop	es
 10088 0000078D 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10089                                  rd_rty:					
 10090 0000078F E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10091 00000792 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10092 00000794 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10093                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10094                                  					; fnon_removable
 10095 00000799 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10096 0000079B 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10097 000007A0 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10098 000007A2 50                      		push	ax
 10099 000007A3 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10100 000007A4 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10101                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10102                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10103                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10104                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10105 000007A8 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10106 000007AA 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10107                                  		; 
 10108 000007AD 1F                      		pop	ds
 10109 000007AE A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10110 000007B1 58                      		pop	ax
 10111                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10112 000007B2 06                      		push	es
 10113 000007B3 1E                      		push	ds
 10114 000007B4 07                      		pop	es
 10115 000007B5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10116 000007B8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10117                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10118                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10119                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10120 000007BA 07                      		pop	es
 10121 000007BB 9C                      		pushf
 10122 000007BC 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10123 000007C1 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10124 000007C3 50                      		push	ax
 10125 000007C4 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10126 000007C7 1E                      		push	ds
 10127 000007C8 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10128 000007CC 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10129 000007CF 1F                      		pop	ds
 10130 000007D0 58                      		pop	ax
 10131                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10132 000007D1 9D                      		popf
 10133 000007D2 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10134 000007D4 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10135                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10136                                  
 10137                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10138 000007D6 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10139                                  					; return error
 10140 000007D8 F9                      		stc
 10141                                  
 10142                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10143                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10144                                  
 10145                                  okret2:					
 10146 000007D9 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10147 000007DD 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10148 000007E1 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10149                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10150                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10151 000007E5 9C                      		pushf
 10152 000007E6 E8FF03                  		call	set_tim
 10153 000007E9 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10154 000007EA 5D                      		pop	bp
 10155 000007EB C3                      		retn
 10156                                  
 10157                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10158                                  ;	disk open/close routines
 10159                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 10161                                  dsk_open:				; 2C7h:80Ah = 70h:2D7Ah
 10162 000007EC 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0

 10166                                  dsk_open_exit:

 10168                                  		; cf = 0			
 10169                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 10248                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 10250                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10251                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10252                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10253                                  
 10254                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10255                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10256                                  ;
 10257                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data

 10259                                  
 10260                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10261                                  checksingle:		
 10262 0000083B 50                      		push	ax
 10263 0000083C 53                      		push	bx
 10264 0000083D 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10265                                  
 10266                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10267                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10268                                  
 10269 00000841 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10270 00000844 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10271 00000846 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10272                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10273 00000849 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10274                                  
 10275                                  
 10276                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10277                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10278                                  
 10279 0000084B 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10280                                  					; get physical drive number
 10281 0000084F 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10282 00000850 57                      		push	di
 10283 00000851 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10284                                  scan_list:				
 10285 00000855 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10286 00000859 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10287 0000085B B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10288 0000085D 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10289 00000861 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10290 00000863 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10291 00000867 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10292 00000868 07                      		pop	es
 10293 00000869 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10294                                  
 10295                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10296                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10297                                  ; in this case.
 10298 0000086D 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10299 00000872 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10300                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10301 00000874 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10302 00000879 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10303 0000087B 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10304                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10305                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10306 0000087F 06                      		push	es
 10307 00000880 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10308 00000884 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10309                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10310                                  					; set up sdsb
 10311 00000888 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10312 00000889 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10313                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10314                                  
 10315                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10316                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10317                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10318                                  
 10319                                  not_fsetowner:

 10321 00000890 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10322 00000892 50                      		push	ax
 10323 00000893 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10324 00000897 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10325 00000899 06                      		push	es
 10326 0000089A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10327 0000089E 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10328                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10329                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10330 000008A3 07                      		pop	es
 10331 000008A4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10332 000008A6 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10333 000008A7 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10334                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10335 000008A9 E88D0E                  		call	swpdsk
 10336 000008AC EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10337                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10338                                  
 10339                                  scan_skip:	
 10340 000008AE 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10341                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10342                                  					; go to	next bds
 10343 000008B1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10344 000008B4 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10345 000008B6 F9                      		stc
 10346 000008B7 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10347 000008B8 07                      		pop	es
 10348                                  
 10349                                  singleret:

 10351 000008BA 58                      		pop	ax

 10372                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10373                                  
 10374                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10375                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10376                                  ;
 10377                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10378                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10379                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10380                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10381                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10382                                  ;	ds = cs
 10383                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10384                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10385                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10386                                  ;
 10387                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10388                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10389                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10390                                  
 10391                                  diskrd:	
 10392                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10393                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10394 000008C4 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10395                                  
 10396                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10397                                  
 10398                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10399                                  diskio:
 10400 000008C9 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10401 000008CB 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10402 000008CF E8F9FB                  		call	SetDrive
 10403 000008D2 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10404 000008D6 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10405                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10406 000008D9 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10407                                  
 10408                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10409                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10410                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10411                                  
 10412 000008DB 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10413                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10414                                  					; unformatted_media
 10415 000008E0 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10416 000008E2 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10417 000008E6 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10418                                  
 10419                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10420                                  
 10421 000008EA 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10422 000008EC 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10423 000008EE 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10424 000008F0 83D600                  		adc	si, 0
 10425 000008F3 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10426                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?
 10427 000008F8 740D                    		jz	short sanity32
 10428 000008FA 83FE00                  		cmp	si, 0
 10429 000008FD 75BD                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10430 000008FF 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10431 00000903 77B7                    		ja	short baddrive
 10432 00000905 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10433                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10434                                  
 10435                                  sanity32:				
 10436 00000907 0336[2B05]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10437 0000090B 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10438 0000090F 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10439 00000911 77A9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10440 00000913 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10441 00000917 77A3                    		ja	short baddrive
 10442                                  
 10443                                  sanityok:				
 10444 00000919 8B16[2B05]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10445 0000091D 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10446 00000921 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10447                                  
 10448                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10449                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10450                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10451                                  
 10452 00000925 A3[2D05]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10453                                  
 10454                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10455                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10456                                  
 10457 00000928 06                      		push	es
 10458 00000929 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10459 0000092D 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 10460                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 10461                                  					; current disk parm table
 10462 00000932 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 10463 00000936 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10464 0000093A 07                      		pop	es
 10465 0000093B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10466                                  					; fnon_removable
 10467 00000940 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10468 00000942 E8F6FE                  		call	checksingle
 10469                                  
 10470                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10471                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10472                                  ; the proper error code.
 10473                                  
 10474 00000945 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10475 0000094A 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10476 0000094C E8B80E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10477                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10478                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10479 0000094F E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10480                                  
 10481                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10482                                  
 10483                                  skip_setup:
 10484                                  
 10485                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10486                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10487                                  				
 10488 00000952 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10489 00000954 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10490 00000956 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10491                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10492 0000095A A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10493 0000095D A1[2D05]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10494 00000960 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10495                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10496                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10497                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10498 00000964 42                      		inc	dx
 10499 00000965 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10500 00000969 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10501                                  					; get number of	heads
 10502 0000096D 50                      		push	ax
 10503 0000096E 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10504 00000970 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder
 10505 00000973 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10506 00000975 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10507 00000978 58                      		pop	ax
 10508 00000979 F7F1                    		div	cx		; now, [temp_h]:ax = cylinder #, dx = head
 10509 0000097B 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
 10510 00000980 7714                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10511 00000982 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024	; 2^10 currently maxium	for track #.
 10512 00000985 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10513 00000987 8816[3201]              		mov	[curhd], dl	; save current head
 10514 0000098B A3[3301]                		mov	[curtrk], ax	; save current track
 10515                                  
 10516                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 10517                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 10518                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.
 10519                                  
 10520 0000098E A1[2201]                		mov	ax, [seccnt]
 10521 00000991 E88400                  		call	block		; (cas - call/ret)
 10522                                  		;call	done
 10523                                  		;retn
 10524                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10525 00000994 EB4B                    		jmp	done
 10526

 10528                                  
 10529                                  baddrive_brdg:

 10533                                  
 10534                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10535                                  ; set the drive-last-accessed flag for diskette only. 
 10536                                  ; we know that the hard disk will not be removed.
 10537                                  ; es:di -> current bds.
 10538                                  ; ds -> Bios_Data
 10539                                  ; ax,cx,si are destroyed.
 10540                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10541                                  
 10542                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10543                                  iosetup:	
 10544 00000999 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10545 0000099D A2[1E01]                		mov	[tim_drv], al	; save drive letter
 10546                                  
 10547                                  ; determine proper head settle values
 10548                                  
 10549 000009A0 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10550 000009A5 7539                    		jnz	short skip_dpt_setting
 10551 000009A7 A0[2C01]                		mov	al, [eot]	; fetch	up eot before changing ds
 10552 000009AA 1E                      		push	ds
 10553 000009AB C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10554 000009AF 884404                  		mov	[si+4],	al
 10555 000009B2 8A440A                  		mov	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 10556 000009B5 8A6404                  		mov	ah, [si+4]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_EOT]
 10557 000009B8 1F                      		pop	ds
 10558 000009B9 A2[2601]                		mov	[motorstartup], al
 10559 000009BC 8826[2B01]              		mov	[save_eot], ah
 10560                                  
 10561                                  ; for 3.5" drives, both external as well as on the k09, we need to set the
 10562                                  ; motor start time to 4. this checking for every i/o is going to affect
 10563                                  ; performance across the board, but is necessary!!
 10564                                  
 10565 000009C0 1E                      		push	ds
 10566 000009C1 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10567 000009C5 26807D2202              		cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 2 ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 10568                                  					; ffSmall

 10570 000009CC B004                    		mov	al, 4
 10571 000009CE 86440A                  		xchg	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 10572                                  motor_start_ok:
 10573                                  
 10574                                  ; ds:si now points to disk parameter table.
 10575                                  ; get current settle and set fast settle
 10576

 10579                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10580 000009D1 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
 10581 000009D3 40                      		inc	ax
 10582 000009D4 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10583                                  					; get settle and set up	for fast
 10584 000009D7 1F                      		pop	ds
 10585 000009D8 A2[2701]                		mov	[settlecurrent], al
 10586 000009DB B00F                    		mov	al, 15		; NORMSETTLE
 10587                                  					; someone has diddled the settle
 10588 000009DD A2[2801]                		mov	[settleslow], al
 10589                                  skip_dpt_setting:			
 10590 000009E0 C3                      		retn
 10591                                  
 10592                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10593                                  
 10594                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10595                                  ; set time of last access, and reset default values in the dpt.
 10596                                  ;
 10597                                  ;	  note: trashes (at least) si

 10601                                  done:

 10605 000009E8 E8FD01                  		call	set_tim
