 13106                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13107                                  
 13108                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13109                                  
 13110                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13111                                  ;
 13112                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13113                                  ;
 13114                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13115                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13116                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13117                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13118                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13119                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13120                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13121                                  ;
 13122                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13123                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13124                                  ;
 13125                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13126                                  
 13127                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13128                                  HMAPtr:
 13129 000013C3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13130                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13131 000013C8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13132                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13133 000013CC 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13134 000013CF 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13135 000013D1 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13136                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13137 000013D6 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13138 000013D8 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13139                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13140 000013DC 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13141                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13142                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13143 000013E0 C3                      		retn
 13144                                  
 13145                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13146                                  
 13147                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13148                                  
 13149                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13150                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13151                                  
 13152                                  move_sector:
 13153                                  
 13154                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13155                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13156                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13157                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13158                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13159                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13160                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13161                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13162                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13163                                  ;
 13164                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13165                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13166                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13167                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13168                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13169                                  
 13170 000013E1 FC                      		cld
 13171 000013E2 51                      		push	cx
 13172 000013E3 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13173 000013E6 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13174 000013EA 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13175 000013EC 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13176 000013F0 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13177 000013F2 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13178 000013F4 59                      		pop	cx
 13179 000013F5 C3                      		retn
 13180                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13181                                  
 13182                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13183 000013F6 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13184 000013F8 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13185 000013FA 59                      		pop	cx
 13186 000013FB C3                      		retn
 13187                                  
 13188                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13189                                  
 13190                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13191                                  
 13192                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13193                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13194                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13195                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13196                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13197                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13198                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13199                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13200                                  ;
 13201                                  ; input conditions:
 13202                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13203                                  ;
 13204                                  ; output:
 13205                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13206                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13207                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13208                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13209                                  
 13210                                  check_wrap:	
 13211 000013FC 50                      		push	ax
 13212 000013FD 53                      		push	bx
 13213 000013FE 06                      		push	es
 13214 000013FF 57                      		push	di
 13215 00001400 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13216 00001403 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13217                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13218 00001405 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13219                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13220 0000140A 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13221 0000140C 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13222 00001410 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13223 00001412 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13224 00001415 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13225 00001417 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13226 00001419 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13227                                  
 13228                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13229                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13230                                  
 13231 0000141B 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13232 0000141D 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13233                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13234 0000141F 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13235 00001420 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13236                                  					; if on	boundary
 13237                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13238                                  not_on_bound:				
 13239 00001422 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13240 00001425 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13241 00001427 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13242 00001429 40                      		inc	ax
 13243 0000142A 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13244 0000142C 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13245 0000142F 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13246                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13247 00001433 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13248 00001435 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13249 00001436 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13250 00001438 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13251 0000143C F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13252                                  
 13253                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13254                                  
 13255 0000143E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13256 00001440 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13257 00001442 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13258                                  
 13259                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13260                                  
 13261 00001444 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13262 00001446 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13263 00001448 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13264                                  no_head_bound:				
 13265 00001449 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13266 0000144B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13267 0000144C FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13268 0000144E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13269 00001450 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13270 00001452 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13271 00001455 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13272 00001457 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13273 00001459 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13274 0000145B 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13275 0000145D 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13276 0000145F D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13277 00001461 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13278 00001463 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13279                                  no_wrap:				
 13280 00001465 F8                      		clc
 13281 00001466 5F                      		pop	di
 13282 00001467 07                      		pop	es
 13283 00001468 5B                      		pop	bx
 13284 00001469 58                      		pop	ax
 13285 0000146A C3                      		retn
 13286                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13287                                  
 13288                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13289 0000146B 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13290 0000146D FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13291 0000146F EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13292                                  
 13293                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13294                                  
 13295                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13296                                  
 13297                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13298                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13299                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13300                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13301                                  ;
 13302                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13303                                  
 13304                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13305                                  find_bds:	
 13306 00001471 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13307                                  fbds_1:					
 13308 00001475 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13309 00001479 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13310 0000147B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13311                                  					; go to next bds
 13312 0000147E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13313 00001481 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13314 00001483 F9                      		stc
 13315                                  fdbs_2:					
 13316 00001484 C3                      		retn
 13317                                  
 13318                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13319                                  
 13320                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13321                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13322                                  doint:
 13323                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13324 00001485 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13325                                  					; get physical drive number
 13326                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13327                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13328                                  		
 13329 00001488 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13330 0000148A 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13331 0000148C 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13332                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13333 0000148E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13334                                  					; get request code
 13335                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13336 00001491 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13337                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13338 00001494 9D                      		popf
 13339                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13340                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13341 00001495 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13342                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13343                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13344 0000149A 9C                      		pushf
 13345                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13346 0000149B 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13347                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13348                                  dointdone:				
 13349 0000149E C3                      		retn
 13350                                  
 13351                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13352                                  
 13353                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13354                                  
 13355                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13356                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13357                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13358                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13359                                  ;
 13360                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13361                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13362                                  ;
 13363                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13364                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13365                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13366                                  
 13367                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13368                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13369                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13370                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13371                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13372                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13373                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13374                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13375                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13376                                  ;end struc
 13377                                  
 13378                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13379                                  
 13380                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13381                                  ;	ah = function
 13382                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13383                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13384                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13385                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13386                                  ;   output conditions:
 13387                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13388                                  
 13389                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13390                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13391                                  ;
 13392                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13393                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13394                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13395                                  
 13396                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13397                                  
 13398                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13399                                  
 13400 0000149F 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13401                                  
 13402                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13403                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13404                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13405                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13406                                  
 13407                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13408                                  
 13409                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13410                                  
 13411                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13412                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13413                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13414                                  
 13415                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13416 000014A3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13417 000014A8 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13418 000014AA 53                      		push	bx
 13419 000014AB BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13420 000014AE E84504                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13421 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13422 000014B2 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13423                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13424                                  
 13425                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13426                                  
 13427                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13428                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13429                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13430                                  
 13431                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13432                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13433 000014B4 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13434 000014B6 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13435 000014B8 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13436 000014B9 51                      		push	cx
 13437 000014BA 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13438 000014BC B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13439 000014BE D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13440 000014C0 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13441 000014C4 59                      		pop	cx
 13442 000014C5 58                      		pop	ax
 13443 000014C6 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13444                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13445 000014C8 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13446 000014C9 06                      		push	es
 13447                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13448 000014CA 2EC41E[9F14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13449                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13450                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13451 000014CF 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13452 000014D1 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13453 000014D4 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13454                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13455                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13456 000014D8 07                      		pop	es
 13457 000014D9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13458 000014DA EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13459                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13460                                  
 13461                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13462                                  
 13463                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13464                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13465                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13466                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13467                                  
 13468                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13469 000014DC 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13470                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13471 000014E1 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13472 000014E3 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13473                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13474 000014E8 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13475                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13476 000014EA 50                      		push	ax
 13477 000014EB B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13478                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13479                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13480 000014ED 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13481                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13482                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13483 000014F2 58                      		pop	ax
 13484 000014F3 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13485                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13486                                  
 13487                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13488                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13489                                  
 13490                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13491                                  
 13492                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13493                                  
 13494                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13495                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13496                                  
 13497                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13498 000014F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13499                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13500                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13501 000014F6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13502                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13503                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13504                                  
 13505                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13506                                  
 13507 000014FB A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13508 000014FE 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13509 00001501 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13510                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13511                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13512 00001503 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13513 00001508 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13514                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13515                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13516                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13517 0000150A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13518                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13519                                  		
 13520 0000150F 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13521                                  		
 13522 00001510 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13523                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13524 00001515 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13525                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13526                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13527 00001517 9D                      		popf
 13528 00001518 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13529                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13530 0000151A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13531 0000151B CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13532                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13533                                  
 13534                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13535                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13536                                  ; a changeline error.
 13537                                  
 13538                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13539 0000151E 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13540                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13541 00001520 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13542 00001523 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13543 00001525 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13544 00001527 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13545 00001529 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13546 0000152E 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13547                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13548                                  					; never	would
 13549 00001530 53                      		push	bx
 13550 00001531 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13551 00001534 E8BF03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13552 00001537 5B                      		pop	bx
 13553                                  int13b:					
 13554 00001538 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13555 00001539 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13556                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13557                                  
 13558                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13559                                  
 13560                                  goterr13:				
 13561 0000153B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13562 0000153E 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13563                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13564 00001540 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13565 00001543 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13566 00001545 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13567 0000154A 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13568                                  
 13569 0000154C 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13570                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13571                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13572                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13573 00001551 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13574                                  
 13575 00001553 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13576                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13577                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13578 00001555 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13579                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13580                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13581 0000155A A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13582 0000155D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13583 0000155F 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13584 00001561 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13585 00001563 53                      		push	bx
 13586 00001564 51                      		push	cx
 13587 00001565 52                      		push	dx
 13588 00001566 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13589                                  loop_ecc:				
 13590 00001569 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13591                                  
 13592                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13593                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13594                                  ;
 13595                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13596                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13597                                  ; track.
 13598                                  ;
 13599                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13600                                  ; this request.
 13601                                  ;
 13602                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13603                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13604                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13605                                  ;
 13606 0000156C E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13607                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13608                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13609 0000156F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13610                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13611 00001574 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13612 00001576 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13613 00001579 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13614 0000157B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13615 0000157E 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13616                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13617                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13618                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13619 00001580 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13620                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13621                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13622                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13623                                  ok11_op:				
 13624 00001582 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13625 00001586 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13626 00001588 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13627                                  					; add 200h to address
 13628 0000158A FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13629 0000158C FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13630 0000158E EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13631                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13632                                  
 13633                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13634                                  
 13635                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13636 00001590 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13637                                  ok11_exit:				
 13638 00001591 5A                      		pop	dx
 13639 00001592 59                      		pop	cx
 13640 00001593 5B                      		pop	bx
 13641 00001594 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13642                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13643                                  
 13644                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13645                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13646                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13647                                  
 13648                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13649 00001596 06                      		push	es
 13650 00001597 53                      		push	bx
 13651 00001598 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13652 0000159B 1E                      		push	ds
 13653 0000159C 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13654 0000159D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13655                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13656                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13657 000015A0 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13658                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13659 000015A5 5B                      		pop	bx
 13660 000015A6 07                      		pop	es
 13661 000015A7 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13662 000015A9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13663 000015AC 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13664                                  
 13665                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13666                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13667                                  
 13668                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13669 000015AE 56                      		push	si
 13670 000015AF 57                      		push	di
 13671 000015B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13672 000015B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13673 000015B5 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13674 000015B8 5F                      		pop	di
 13675 000015B9 5E                      		pop	si
 13676 000015BA EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13677                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13678                                  
 13679                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13680                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13681                                  
 13682                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13683 000015BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13684 000015BF FB                      		sti
 13685 000015C0 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13686 000015C3 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13687                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13688                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13689 000015C5 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13690 000015C8 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13691 000015CA 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13692 000015CD 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13693 000015CF 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13694                                  
 13695                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13696                                  
 13697                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13698                                  
 13699 000015D1 52                      		push	dx
 13700 000015D2 51                      		push	cx
 13701 000015D3 53                      		push	bx
 13702 000015D4 50                      		push	ax
 13703 000015D5 55                      		push	bp
 13704 000015D6 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13705 000015D8 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13706 000015DA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13707 000015DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13708 000015DE D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13709 000015E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13710 000015E2 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13711 000015E4 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13712                                  
 13713                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13714                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13715                                  
 13716 000015E8 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13717 000015EA E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13718                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13719                                  
 13720                                  no_skip_first:				
 13721 000015ED D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13722 000015EF B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13723 000015F1 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13724                                  
 13725                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13726                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13727                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13728                                  ;
 13729                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13730                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13731                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13732                                  ; in error.
 13733                                  
 13734 000015F3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13735 000015F5 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13736                                  
 13737                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13738                                  
 13739 000015F7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13740                                  					; set up head number
 13741 000015FA E888FE                  		call	doint
 13742 000015FD E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13743                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13744                                  
 13745                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13746 00001600 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13747 00001602 F9                      		stc
 13748 00001603 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13749                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13750                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13751                                  
 13752                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13753                                  
 13754                                  intverify:				
 13755 00001606 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13756 00001607 53                      		push	bx
 13757 00001608 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13758 00001609 07                      		pop	es
 13759                                  dosimple:				
 13760 0000160A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13761                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13762                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13763                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13764 0000160D 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13765                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13766 00001612 5B                      		pop	bx
 13767 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 13768 00001614 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13769                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13770                                  
 13771                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13772                                  
 13773                                  intformat:				
 13774 00001617 06                      		push	es
 13775 00001618 53                      		push	bx
 13776 00001619 56                      		push	si
 13777 0000161A 57                      		push	di
 13778 0000161B 1E                      		push	ds
 13779                                  
 13780                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13781                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13782                                  
 13783 0000161C 06                      		push	es
 13784 0000161D 1E                      		push	ds
 13785 0000161E 07                      		pop	es
 13786 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13787 00001620 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13788 00001622 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13789 00001625 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13790 00001628 1F                      		pop	ds
 13791 00001629 5F                      		pop	di
 13792 0000162A 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13793 0000162B EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13794                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13795                                  
 13796                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13797                                  ; the first block.
 13798                                  ;
 13799                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13800                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13801                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13802                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13803                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13804                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13805                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13806                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13807                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13808                                  
 13809                                  doblock:
 13810                                  
 13811                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13812                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13813                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13814                                  				
 13815 0000162D 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13816                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13817 00001630 51                      		push	cx
 13818 00001631 06                      		push	es
 13819 00001632 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13820                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13821 00001633 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13822 00001636 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13823                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13824 0000163A 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13825                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13826 0000163F 5F                      		pop	di
 13827 00001640 07                      		pop	es
 13828 00001641 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13829 00001643 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13830 00001645 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13831 00001647 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13832                                  doblockflop:				
 13833 00001649 59                      		pop	cx
 13834                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13835 0000164A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13836 0000164C 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13837 0000164E 50                      		push	ax
 13838 0000164F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13839 00001651 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13840                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13841                                  
 13842                                  doblocklast:				
 13843 00001653 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13844 00001655 50                      		push	ax
 13845                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13846 00001656 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13847 00001659 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13848 0000165B 58                      		pop	ax
 13849 0000165C 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13850                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13851 0000165F 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13852 00001661 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13853 00001663 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13854 00001665 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13855 00001667 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13856                                  					; then we are done already.
 13857 00001669 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13858                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13859 0000166B E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13860 0000166E EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13861                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13862                                  
 13863                                  bufferx:				
 13864 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13865                                  					; set up head number
 13866                                  buffer:					
 13867 00001673 53                      		push	bx
 13868 00001674 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13869 00001677 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13870 0000167A 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13871                                  					
 13872                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13873                                  
 13874 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 13875 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds
 13876 0000167E 56                      		push	si
 13877 0000167F 57                      		push	di
 13878 00001680 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13879 00001681 06                      		push	es
 13880 00001682 1F                      		pop	ds
 13881 00001683 07                      		pop	es
 13882 00001684 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13883 00001687 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13884 00001688 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13885 0000168A E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13886 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13887                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13888 0000168E 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13889 0000168F 5E                      		pop	si
 13890 00001690 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13891                                  
 13892                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13893                                  
 13894 00001691 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13895                                  					; get drive number
 13896 00001693 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13897 00001696 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13898                                  					;
 13899                                  					; ah is	function
 13900                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13901                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13902                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13903                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13904                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13905 00001699 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13906 0000169C 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13907 0000169D 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13908 0000169F EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13909                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13910                                  
 13911                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13912                                  
 13913                                  doread:					
 13914 000016A1 06                      		push	es
 13915 000016A2 53                      		push	bx
 13916 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13917 000016A4 07                      		pop	es
 13918 000016A5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13919 000016A8 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13920 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13921                                  					; get drive number
 13922 000016AD E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13923                                  					; ah = function
 13924                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13925                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13926                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13927 000016B0 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13928 000016B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 13929 000016B4 07                      		pop	es
 13930 000016B5 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13931 000016B7 56                      		push	si
 13932 000016B8 57                      		push	di
 13933 000016B9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13934 000016BB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13935 000016BE E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13936 000016C1 5F                      		pop	di
 13937 000016C2 5E                      		pop	si
 13938                                  
 13939                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13940                                  
 13941                                  dotail:					
 13942 000016C3 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13943 000016C4 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13944 000016C7 41                      		inc	cx
 13945 000016C8 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13946 000016CB F8                      		clc
 13947 000016CC FEC8                    		dec	al
 13948 000016CE 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13949                                  
 13950                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 13951                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 13952                                  
 13953 000016D0 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13954 000016D3 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 13955 000016D6 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 13956                                  
 13957                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 13958                                  
 13959                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 13960                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 13961                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 13962                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 13963                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 13964                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 13965                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 13966                                  
 13967                                  bad13:					
 13968 000016D9 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 13969 000016DB 5D                      		pop	bp
 13970 000016DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 13971 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13972 000016DE 59                      		pop	cx
 13973 000016DF 5A                      		pop	dx
 13974 000016E0 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 13975 000016E2 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 13976                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13977                                  
 13978                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 13979 000016E5 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 13980                                  
 13981                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13982                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13983                                  		;db 	0
 13984                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13985                                  
 13986                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 13987

 13996                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 13997 000016E8 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 13998 000016EC BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 13999 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14000 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 14001 000016F1 E9C4EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14002                                  
 14003                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14004                                  
 14005                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14006                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14007                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14008                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14009                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14010                                  
 14011                                  install_bds:		
 14012 000016F4 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14013 000016F5 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14014                                  
 14015                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14016                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14017                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14018 000016F8 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14019                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14020 000016FA 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14021 000016FE 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14022                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14023 00001701 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14024 00001703 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14025 00001705 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14026                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14027 00001709 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14028 0000170C 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14029                                  					; we don't own it
 14030 00001711 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14031                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14032 00001714 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14033 00001717 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14034                                  next_bds:				
 14035 0000171B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14036                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14037 0000171E 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14038 00001720 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14039                                  					; install bds
 14040 00001723 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14041 00001725 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14042                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14043 0000172A 1F                      		pop	ds
 14044                                  
 14045                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 14046                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14047                                  
 14048                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14049                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14050                                  
 14051                                  		; 01/06/2019
 14052 0000172B 268A4534                		mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14053                                  		; 22/07/2023
 14054                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14055 0000172F 3A06[2C01]              		cmp	al,[eot]
 14056 00001733 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14057 00001735 A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot],al
 14058                                  _eot_ok:
 14059 00001738 C3                      		retn

 14073                                  ;  ask to swap the disk in drive a:

 14078                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14079 00001739 F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14080                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14081 0000173E 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14082                                  		
 14083                                  		; set focus to the correct VM
 14084                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah
 14085                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14086 00001740 9A[CF08]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14087                                  		;call	far ptr	V86_Crit_SetFocus ; call far 70h:8D1h
 14088                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14089                                  no_win386:

 14091 00001746 52                      		push	dx
 14092 00001747 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14093                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14094                                  
 14095                                  ; WARNING : next two instructions assume that if the new disk is for drive B
 14096                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
 14097                                  
 14098 0000174B 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14099 0000174D 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14100 00001750 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14101 00001752 B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 14102                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 14103                                  					; Broadcast it

 14105 00001757 41                      		inc	cx		; cx == -1 ?
 14106 00001758 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 14107                                  
 14108                                  ; using a different drive in a one drive system so request the user change disks
 14109                                  
 14110 0000175A 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'
 14111                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14112 0000175D 2E8816[9717]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl
 14113                                  		; 16/10/2022
 14114                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:drvlet], dl
 14115                                  		;mov	byte ptr cs:17E4h, dl ; [cs:drvlet]
 14116                                  					; 0070h:3D54h =	2C7h:17E4h
 14117 00001762 BE[7B17]                		mov	si, SNGMSG
 14118                                  		;mov	si, 17C8h	; sngmsg
 14119                                  					; 0070h:3D38h =	2C7h:17C8h
 14120 00001765 53                      		push	bx
 14121 00001766 2E                      		cs
 14122 00001767 AC                      		lodsb			; get the next character of the message
 14123                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14124                                  wrmsg_loop:				
 14125 00001768 CD29                    		int	29h		; DOS 2+ internal - FAST PUTCHAR
 14126                                  					; AL = character to display
 14127 0000176A 2E                      		cs
 14128 0000176B AC                      		lodsb

 14130                                  					; get the next character of the	message
