 18786                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18787                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 18788                                  ;
 18789                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18790                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 18791                                  ;
 18792                                  ; Inputs : None
 18793                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 18794                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 18795                                  ;	   free memory.
 18796                                  ;
 18797                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 18798                                  ;
 18799                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18800                                  	
 18801                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2

 18828                                  ; procedure : LoadDOSHiOrLo
 18829                                  ;
 18830                                  ;		Tries to move DOS into HMA. If it fails then loads
 18831                                  ;		DOS into Low memory. For ROMDOS, nothing is actually
 18832                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 18833                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.
 18834                                  ;
 18835                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18836                                  
 18837                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18838                                  LoadDOSHiOrLo:

 18840                                  	; ds = cs
 18841 00000950 E81F00                  	call	TryToMovDOSHi		; Try moving it into HMA (M024)
 18842                                  	;jc	short LdngLo		; If that don't work...
 18843                                  	;retn
 18844                                  	; 18/12/2022
 18845 00000953 731C                    	jnc	short LoadDosHi_ok
 18846                                  LdngLo:
 18847                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18848                                  	;push	cs
 18849                                  	;pop	ds
 18850                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18851                                  	; ds = cs
 18852 00000955 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 18853 00000957 BA[FD08]                	mov	dx,DOSLOMSG		; inform user that we are
 18854 0000095A CD21                    	int	21h			; loading low
 18855                                  
 18856                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18857                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.
 18858                                  
 18859 0000095C BB0100                  	mov	bx,1				; M012
 18860                                  						;  use int 21 alloc for mem
 18861 0000095F E83F00                  	call	MovDOSLo
 18862                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18863                                  	; ds = cs
 18864                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]	; give dos its temporary loc.
 18865                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18870                                  	; 11/12/2022

 18885                                  ;
 18886                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18887                                  ;
 18888                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18889                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18890                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18891                                  ;
 18892                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18893                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18894                                  ; 
 18895                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18896                                  
 18897                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18898                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 18899                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 18900                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18901                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18902                                  	; ds = cs
 18903 00000972 E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 18904 00000975 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 18905                                  
 18906                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18907                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18908                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 18909                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18910                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18911                                  	; ds = cs
 18912 00000977 8E06[7302]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 18913                                  ;else
 18914                                  ;	..
 18915                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18916                                  
 18917                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18918                                  	; ds = cs
 18919 0000097B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 18920                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 18921 0000097D FF1E[7D02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 18922                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 18923 00000981 C606[6C02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 18924 00000986 F8                      	clc
 18925                                  ttldhx:
 18926 00000987 C3                      	retn

 18934                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.

 19283 000009FE 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc

 19285 00000A02 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 19286 00000A04 CD21                    	int	21h
 19287 00000A06 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 19288                                   	; 23/10/2022

 19291                                  						;  BIOS code

 19295                                  	; 14/05/2019

 19302 00000A1B C3                      	retn
 19303                                  
 19304                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19305                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19306                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19307                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19308                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19309                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19310                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19311                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19312                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19313                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19314                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19315                                  ;
 19316                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19317                                  
 19318                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19319                                  update_arena:
 19320 00000A1C 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19321 00000A1D 57                      	push	di
 19322 00000A1E 51                      	push	cx
 19323 00000A1F 52                      	push	dx
 19324                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19325                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19326                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19327                                  	; ds = cs 
 19328 00000A20 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19329 00000A24 4F                      	dec	di
 19330 00000A25 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19331                                  						;  before sysvar
 19332 00000A26 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19333                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19334 00000A28 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19335 00000A2D 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19336 00000A2F 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19337                                  
 19338                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19339 00000A31 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19340 00000A36 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19341 00000A38 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19342 00000A3A 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19343 00000A3C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19344                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19345 00000A3E 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19346                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19347 00000A42 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19348 00000A48 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block

 19382                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19383                                  ;
 19384                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19385                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19386                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19387                                  ;

 19394                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't

 19396                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low

 19551                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19552                                  ;
 19553                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19554                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19555                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19556                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19557                                  ;
 19558                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19559                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19560                                  ;
 19561                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19562                                  
 19563                                  StartVDHead:
 19564                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19565                                  
 19566 00000ADC 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19567 00000AE0 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19568 00000AE2 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19569 00000AE4 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19570 00000AE6 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19571                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19572 00000AE7 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19573                                  VDiskSig1:
 19574 00000AEE 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19575                                  
 19576                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19577                                  
 19578 00000AF3 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19579                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19580 00000AF9 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19581 00000B08 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19582 00000B0A 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19583                                  VDInt19:
 19584 00000B0B EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19585                                  OldVDInt19:
 19586 00000B0C 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19587                                  
 19588                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19589                                  
 19590                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19591 00000B10 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19592                                  VDiskSig2:
 19593 00000B13 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19594                                  
 19595                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19596                                  
 19597 00000B18 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19598 00000B1B 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19599 00000B1D 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19600 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19601 00000B20 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19602 00000B21 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19603 00000B23 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19604 00000B25 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19605 00000B26 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19606 00000B28 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19607 00000B2A 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19608 00000B2C 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19609 00000B2E 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19610                                  
 19611                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 19613                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19614                                  ;
 19615                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19616                                  ;
 19617                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19618                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19619                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19620                                  ;
 19621                                  ; Inputs : None
 19622                                  ;
 19623                                  ; Outputs : None
 19624                                  ;
 19625                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19626                                  ;
 19627                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19628                                  
 19629                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19630                                  
 19631                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19632 00000B30 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19633 00000B32 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19634                                  
 19635                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19636                                  
 19637                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19638 00000B34 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19639                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19640 00000B37 2EA3[0C0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19641 00000B3B A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19642                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19643 00000B3E 2EA3[0E0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19644                                  
 19645                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19646                                  
 19647 00000B42 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19648                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19649                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19650 00000B44 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19651 00000B47 CD21                    	int	21h
 19652                                  
 19653                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19654                                  
 19655 00000B49 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19656 00000B4A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19657                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19658 00000B4C 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19659                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19660 00000B53 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19661 00000B5A 40                      	inc	ax
 19662 00000B5B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19663                                  
 19664                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19665                                  
 19666 00000B5D FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19667                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19668 00000B5E C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19669 00000B64 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19670                                  
 19671                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 19672                                  
 19673                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 19674 00000B67 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 19675 00000B6A BE[DC0A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 19676 00000B6D 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19677 00000B6F 0E                      	push	cs
 19678 00000B70 1F                      	pop	ds
 19679 00000B71 FC                      	cld
 19680 00000B72 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19681 00000B74 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 19682                                  
 19683                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 19684                                  
 19685                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19686 00000B75 57                      	push	di
 19687 00000B76 06                      	push	es
 19688                                  
 19689 00000B77 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19690 00000B7A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19691 00000B7C BF1000                  	mov	di,10h

 19693 00000B7F B92000                  	mov	cx,32

 19750                                  
 19751                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19752                                  
 19753                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 19754                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19755                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19756                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19757                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19758                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19759                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19760                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19761                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19762                                  ;								      ;I070
 19763                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19764                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19765                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19766                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19767                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19768                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19769                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19770                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19771                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19772                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19773                                  ;								      ;I070
 19774                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19775                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19776                                  
 19777                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19778                                  	; ds = cs
 19779                                  
 19780                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 19781                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 19782

 19785 00000BDD 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 19786 00000BDF B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 19787 00000BE1 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 19788 00000BE3 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19789 00000BE5 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl

 19791 00000BEA 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 19792                                  
 19793                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 19794                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 19795                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax

 19816                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19817                                  ;
 19818                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19819                                  ;
 19820                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19821                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19822                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19823                                  ;		the offset.
 19824                                  ;
 19825                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 19826                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 19827                                  ;
 19828                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19829                                  
 19830                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 19831 00000C02 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 19832 00000C04 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 19833 00000C07 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19834 00000C09 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19835 00000C0C 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19836 00000C0F B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19837 00000C11 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19838 00000C13 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19839 00000C15 1E                      	push	ds
 19840                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h

 19852                                  ; procedure : IsVDiskInstalled
 19853                                  ;
 19854                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 19855                                  ;		& INT 19 vector
 19856                                  ;
 19857                                  ; Inputs  : A20 flag should be ON
 19858                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared

 19867                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19869                                  	;mov	cx,VLEN1 ; 5

 19871 00000C34 0E                      	push	cs
 19872 00000C35 07                      	pop	es
 19873 00000C36 BF[EE0A]                	mov	di,VDiskSig1
 19874 00000C39 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 19875 00000C3B 7410                    	je	short ivdins_retn

 19877 00000C40 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax

 19887                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19888                                  ;
 19889                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 19890                                  ;
 19891                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 19892                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 19893                                  ;
 19894                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19895                                  
 19896                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19897                                  CPMHack:
 19898 00000C4E 1E                      	push	ds
 19899 00000C4F B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 19900 00000C52 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 19901                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 19902                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19903 00000C54 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 19904 00000C55 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 19905 00000C57 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 19906 00000C5A BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 19907                                  	;mov	cx,5
 19908 00000C5D B105                    	mov	cl,5
 19909 00000C5F FC                      	cld
 19910 00000C60 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 19911 00000C62 1F                      	pop	ds
 19912 00000C63 C3                      	retn

 20015                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 20016                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 20017                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to
 20018                                  ;	0 out curdir_flags,curdir_devptr of cds so ibmdos can issue
 20019                                  ;	"invalid drive specification" message when the user try to
 20020                                  ;	access them.
 20021                                  ;
 20022                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 20023                                  ;	(es:di) = CURDIR_FLAGS in the CDS records

 20029                                  ;	check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not go to normcds.

 20065                                  ;	set curdir_flags to 0. this is for signaling ibmdos and ifsfunc that

 20794                                  
 20795                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20796                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20797                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20798                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20799                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20800                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20801                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20802                                  ;
 20803                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20804                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20805                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20806                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20807                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20808                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20809                                  ;
 20810                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20811                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20812                                  ;
 20813                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20814                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20815                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20816                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20817                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20818                                  ;
 20819                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20820                                  ;
 20821                                  ;			  none.
 20822                                  
 20823                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20824                                  ;
 20825                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20826                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20827                                  
 20828                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20829                                  
 20830 00001001 50                      	push	ax
 20831 00001002 53                      	push	bx
 20832 00001003 52                      	push	dx
 20833 00001004 06                      	push	es
 20834                                  
 20835 00001005 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port
 20836 00001007 BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 20837 0000100A EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 20838 0000100B 42                      	inc	dx
 20839 0000100C EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f3h,0ffh
 20840 0000100D 42                      	inc	dx
 20841 0000100E EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f4h,0ffh
 20842 0000100F 42                      	inc	dx
 20843 00001010 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f5h,0ffh
 20844 00001011 42                      	inc	dx
 20845 00001012 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f6h,0ffh
 20846 00001013 42                      	inc	dx
 20847 00001014 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f7h,0ffh
 20848                                  
 20849                                  ;sb secondary global rearm
 20850                                  
 20851 00001015 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;get machine type

 20855

 20857 00001024 CD15                    	int	15h			; *
 20858 00001026 7216                    	jc	short finishrearm	; *jmp if old rom

 20867                                  startrearm:
 20868 0000102F B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;write any pattern to port
 20869 00001031 BAF206                  	mov	dx,6F2h 		;get starting address
 20870 00001034 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f2h,0ffh
 20871 00001035 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20872 00001036 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f3h,0ffh
 20873 00001037 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20874 00001038 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f4h,0ffh
 20875 00001039 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20876 0000103A 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20877 0000103B EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f6h,0ffh
 20878 0000103C 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 20879 0000103D EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f7h,0ffh

 20881                                  finishrearm:

 21032                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21033                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21034                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21035                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21036                                  ;
 21037                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21038                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21039                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21040                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21041                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21042                                  ; program).
 21043                                  
 21044                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21045                                  
 21046                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21047                                  
 21048 000010E9 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21049                                  
 21050                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21051                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21052                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21053                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21054                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21055                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21056                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21057                                  ; carridge return.
 21058                                  
 21059                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21060                                  ;character after =.
 21061                                  
 21062 000010EA 06                      	push	es
 21063 000010EB 1E                      	push	ds
 21064 000010EC 07                      	pop	es
 21065 000010ED 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21066 000010EE 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21067                                  
 21068 000010F0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21069 000010F2 FC                      	cld
 21070 000010F3 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21071 000010F9 BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21072                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21073 000010FC AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21074 000010FD 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21075 000010FF 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21076 00001101 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21077                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21078 00001103 AC                      	lodsb
 21079 00001104 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21080 00001107 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21081 00001109 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21082 0000110B FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21083 0000110D 47                      	inc	di
 21084 0000110E EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21085                                  done_installparm:
 21086 00001110 2E880E[F002]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21087 00001115 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21088 00001118 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21089 0000111A 2EC606[F102]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21090                                  					; starts with cr.
 21091                                  install_seg_set:
 21092 00001120 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21093 00001127 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 21094

 21151                                  
 21152                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 21153 0000115D 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 21154 0000115E 06                      	push	es
 21155 0000115F 1E                      	push	ds
 21156 00001160 07                      	pop	es
 21157 00001161 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 21158 00001162 7305                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 21159                                  
 21160 00001164 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 21161 00001165 E8EE33                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 21162 00001168 5E                      	pop	si
 21163                                  
 21164                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21165                                  	;jmp	short sysinitptr_retn ; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1140h)
 21166                                  	; 11/12/2022

 21193                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21194                                  
 21195                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21196                                  ;
 21197                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21198                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21199                                  ;
 21200                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21201                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21202                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21203                                  
 21204                                  ParaRound:
 21205 0000116A 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21206 0000116D D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21207 0000116F D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21208 00001171 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21209 00001173 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21210 00001175 C3                      	retn
 21211                                  
 21212                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21213                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21214                                  ;
 21215                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21216                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21217                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21218                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21219                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21220                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21221                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21222                                  ;
 21223                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21224                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21225                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21226                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21227                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21228                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21229                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21230                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21231                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21232                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21233                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21234                                  ;
 21235                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21236                                  
 21237                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21238                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21239                                  sysinit_base:				
 21240 00001176 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21241 0000117B 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21242 00001180 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21243 00001182 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21244 00001187 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21245 0000118C 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21246 0000118D 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21247 0000118E 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21248                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21249                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21250 00001190 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21251 00001193 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21252 00001198 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21253                                  
 21254                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21255                                  
 21256 0000119A B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21257 0000119C 0E                      	push	cs
 21258 0000119D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21259                                  	; 30/12/2022
 21260                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 21261                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 21262 0000119E BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21263                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21264 000011A1 CD21                    	int	21h
 21265                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21266                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21267                                  
 21268                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21269                                  stall:
 21270                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21271                                  _stall: 
 21272                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21273 000011A3 F4                      	hlt 
 21274                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21275                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21276 000011A4 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21277                                  
 21278                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21279 000011A6 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21280                                  
 21281                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21282                                  
 21283                                  sum_up:
 21284                                  
 21285                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21286                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21287                                  ;
 21288                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21289                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21290                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21291                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21292                                  ;
 21293                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21294                                  
 21295 000011AB 1E                      	push	ds
 21296                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21297                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 21298 000011AC 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21299                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21300                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21301 000011B0 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21302 000011B2 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21303 000011B4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21304 000011B6 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21305                                  					; whole test better fail.
 21306 000011BB D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21307 000011BD 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21308                                  sum1:
 21309 000011BF 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21310 000011C1 46                      	inc	si
 21311 000011C2 46                      	inc	si
 21312 000011C3 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21313                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21314                                  sum_sys_code:
 21315                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21316 000011C5 BEC411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21317                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21318                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21319                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21320                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21321                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21322                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21323                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 21324 000011C8 B9[204E]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21325 000011CB 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21326 000011CD D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21327                                  sum2:
 21328 000011CF 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21329 000011D2 46                      	inc	si
 21330 000011D3 46                      	inc	si
 21331 000011D4 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21332 000011D6 1F                      	pop	ds
 21333 000011D7 C3                      	retn
 21334                                  
 21335                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21336                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21337                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 21338                                  
 21339                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21340                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h)

 21344 000011DA 0000                    	dw	0

 21415                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0

 21431                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21432                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21433                                  ;
 21434                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem

 21442 00001251 53                      	push	bx
 21443 00001252 52                      	push	dx

 21445 00001257 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21446                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21447 0000125C 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21448                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21449                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21450                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21451 0000125F 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21452 00001261 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21453 00001263 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h

 21455 00001266 CD2F                    	int	2Fh

 21457 0000126B 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21458 0000126D BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21459                                  	;zf=1

 21461                                  	;zf=1
 21462 00001270 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21463                                  got_hma:

 21465 00001276 5B                      	pop	bx

 21496                                  ; ======================================================================
 21497                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21498                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21499                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21500                                  
 21501                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21502                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21503                                  ;
 21504                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21505                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21506                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21507                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21508                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21509                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21510                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21511                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21512                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21513                                  ;
 21514                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21515                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21516                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21517                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21518                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21519                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21520                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21521                                  ;	conditions:
 21522                                  ;
 21523                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21524                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21525                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21526                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21527                                  ;
 21528                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21529                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21530                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21531                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21532                                  ;
 21533                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21534                                  ;
 21535                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21536                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21537                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21538                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21539                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21540                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21541                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21542                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21543                                  ;
 21544                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21545                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21546                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21547                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21548                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21549                                  ;
 21550                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21551                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21552                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21553                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21554                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21555                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21556                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21557                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21558                                  ;
 21559                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21560                                  
 21561                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21562                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21563                                  
 21564                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21565                                  stackinit:
 21566 000012A0 50                      	push	ax
 21567 000012A1 1E                      	push	ds
 21568 000012A2 06                      	push	es
 21569 000012A3 53                      	push	bx
 21570 000012A4 51                      	push	cx
 21571 000012A5 52                      	push	dx
 21572 000012A6 57                      	push	di
 21573 000012A7 56                      	push	si
 21574 000012A8 55                      	push	bp
 21575                                  
 21576                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21577                                  
 21578                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21579                                  	; ds = cs
 21580 000012A9 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21581 000012AC 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21582                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21583                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21584                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21585 000012AE 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21586                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21587 000012B2 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21588 000012B5 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21589                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21590 000012B9 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21591                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21592                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21593                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21594 000012BC 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21595                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21596 000012C0 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21597 000012C2 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21598                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 22398                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22399                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22400                                  
 22401                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22402                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22403                                  
 22404                                  new_init_loop:
 22405                                  
 22406                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22407                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22408                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22409                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22410                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22411                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22412                                  
 22413 00001494 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22414 00001497 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22415 00001499 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22416 0000149D 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22417                                  
 22418 000014A0 1E                      	push	ds
 22419                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22420                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22421                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22422 000014A1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22423 000014A4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22424 000014A6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22425 000014A9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22426 000014AB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22427 000014AF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22428 000014B2 1F                      	pop	ds
 22429                                  
 22430 000014B3 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22431 000014B6 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22432 000014BA C3                      	retn
 22433                                  
 22434                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22435                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22436                                  
 22437                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22438                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22439                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22440                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22441                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22442                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22443                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22444                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22445                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22446                                  
 22447                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22448                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22449                                  
 22450                                  setdevmark:
 22451                                  
 22452 000014BB 06                      	push	es
 22453 000014BC 51                      	push	cx
 22454                                  
 22455 000014BD 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22456 000014C2 2E890E[E214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22457 000014C7 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22458                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22459                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22460 000014C9 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22461 000014CD 41                      	inc	cx
 22462                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22463 000014CE 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22464                                  
 22465 000014D3 59                      	pop	cx
 22466 000014D4 07                      	pop	es
 22467 000014D5 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22468 000014DA C3                      	retn
