 22684 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22685 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22686 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22687                                  endstruc
 22688                                  
 22689                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22690                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22691                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22692                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22693                                  
 22694                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22695                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22696                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22697                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22698                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22699                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22700                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22701                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22702                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22703                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22704                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22705                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22706                                  
 22707                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22708                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22709 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22710 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22711 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22712                                  endstruc
 22713                                  
 22714                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22715                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22716                                  ;
 22717                                  ;
 22718                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22719                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22720                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22721                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22722                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22723                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22724                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22725                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22726                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22727                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22728                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22729                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22730                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22731                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22732                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22733                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22734                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22735                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22736                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22737                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22738                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22739                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22740                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22741                                  ;	   :
 22742                                  ;
 22743                                  ;Note:
 22744                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22745                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22746                                  ;
 22747                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22748                                  ;
 22749                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22750                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22751                                  ;
 22752                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22753                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22754                                  ;
 22755                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22756                                  ;
 22757                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22758                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22759                                  ;
 22760                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22761                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22762                                  ;
 22763                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22764                                  ;
 22765                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22766                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22767                                  ;
 22768                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22769                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22770                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22771                                  ;
 22772                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22773                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22774                                  ;
 22775                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22776                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22777                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22778                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22779                                  
 22780                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22781                                  
 22782                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22783                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22784                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22785                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22786                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22787                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22788                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22789                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22790                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22791                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22792                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22793                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22794                                  
 22795                                  ;**** Function flags
 22796                                  
 22797                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22798                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22799                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22800                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22801                                  
 22802                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22803                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22804 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22805 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22806 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22807 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22808 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22809 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22810                                  endstruc
 22811                                  
 22812                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22813                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22814                                  ;
 22815                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22816                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22817                                  ;	     +-
 22818                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22819                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22820                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22821                                  ;	     |	:
 22822                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22823                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22824                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22825                                  ;	     |	:
 22826                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22827                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22828                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22829                                  ;	     +-	:
 22830                                  ;
 22831                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22832                                  ;
 22833                                  ;Note:
 22834                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22835                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22836                                  ;
 22837                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22838                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22839                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22840                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22841                                  
 22842                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22843                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22844                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22845                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22846                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22847                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22848                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22849                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22850                                  
 22851                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22852 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22853 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22854 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22855 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22856 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22857                                  endstruc
 22858                                  
 22859                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22860                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22861                                  ;
 22862                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22863                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22864                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22865                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22866                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22867                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22868                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22869                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22870                                  ;
 22871                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22872                                  ;
 22873                                  ;            +-
 22874                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22875                                  ;	    | or
 22876                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22877                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22878                                  ;	    | or
 22879                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22880                                  ;	    | or
 22881                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22882                                  ;	    | or
 22883                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22884                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22885                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22886                                  ;	    | or
 22887                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22888                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22889                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22890                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22891                                  ;	    +-
 22892                                  ;
 22893                                  ;
 22894                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22895                                  ;      list.
 22896                                  ;
 22897                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22898                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22899                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22900                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22901

 22906 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22907 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22908                                  endstruc

 22933                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22934                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22935                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22936                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22937                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22938                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22939                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23021                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 23022                                  ; ======================================================================
 23023                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23024                                  
 23025                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23026                                  ; SysParse;
 23027                                  ;
 23028                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23029                                  ;
 23030                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23031                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23032                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23033                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23034                                  ;
 23035                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23036                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23037                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23038                                  ;
 23039                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23040                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23041                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23042                                  ;
 23043                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23044                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23045                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23046                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23047                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23048                                  ;
 23049                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23050                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23051                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23052                                  ;
 23053                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23054                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23055                                  ;
 23056                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23057                                  ;
 23058                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23059                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23060                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23061                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23062                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23063                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23064                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23065                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23066                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23067                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23068                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23069                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23070                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23071                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23072                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23073                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23074                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23075                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23076                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23077                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23078                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23079                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23080                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23081                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23082                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23083                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23084                                  ;					  (tm14)

 23435                                  ; _$P_Chk_Pos_Control
 23436                                  ;
 23437                                  ; Function: Parse CONTROL block for a positional
 23438                                  ;
 23439                                  ; Input:     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23440                                  ;	     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23441                                  ;

 23661                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23662                                  ;
 23663                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23664                                  ;
 23665                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23666                                  ;	    AL = type
 23667                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23668                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23669                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23670                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23671                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23672                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths

 23674                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 24071                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24072                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24073                                  ;
 24074                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24075                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24076                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24077                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24078                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24079                                  ;
 24080                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24081                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24082                                  ;
 24083                                  ; Output:    None
 24084                                  ;
 24085                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24086                                  ;
 24087                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24088                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24089                                  
 24090                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24091                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24092                                  
 24093                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24094                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 24095                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24096 0000197E 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24097 0000197F 2E800E[F814]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24098 00001985 2E8026[F814]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24099                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 24100 0000198B 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24101 0000198E 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24102 00001990 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24103                                  
 24104 00001992 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24105 00001994 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24106                                  
 24107 00001996 2E800E[F814]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24108                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24109 0000199C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24110                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24111 0000199D E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24112 000019A0 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24113 000019A1 C3                      	retn
 24114                                  
 24115                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24116                                  
 24117                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24118                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 24119                                  
 24120                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24121                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 24122 000019A2 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24123 000019A3 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24124 000019A4 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24125 000019A5 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24126 000019A6 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 24127 000019A8 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 24128 000019AA 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 24129                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 24130 000019AB 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24131 000019AE 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 24132 000019B0 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 24133                                  
 24134 000019B2 E8DD00                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 24135 000019B5 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 24136                                  
 24137 000019B7 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 24138 000019B9 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 24139                                  
 24140                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24141                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 24142                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 24143                                  %if 0
 24144                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 24145                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24146                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24147                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24148                                  
 24149                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 24150                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 24151                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 24152                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24153                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24154                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24155                                  
 24156                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 24157                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24158                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24159                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24160                                  
 24161                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 24162                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 24163                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24164                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24165                                  
 24166                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 24167                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 24168                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24169                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24170                                  
 24171                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 24172                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24173                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 24174                                  %endif
 24175                                  ;****
 24176                                  %if 1
 24177                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24178                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2130h)
 24179                                  
 24180 000019BB 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 24181 000019BD 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; save binary number
 24182 000019BF E81C00                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 24183 000019C2 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx			; ax:bx = 2*(cx:dx)
 24184 000019C4 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 24185 000019C6 E81500                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 24186 000019C9 E81200                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 24187 000019CC 01DA                    	add	dx,bx			; 8*(cx:dx)+2*(cx:dx) = 10*(cx:dx)
 24188 000019CE 11C1                    	adc	cx,ax
 24189 000019D0 E80F00                  	call	_$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF
 24190 000019D3 01EA                    	add	dx,bp			; Add the current one degree decimal
 24191                                  					; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 24192 000019D5 83D100                  	adc	cx,0
 24193 000019D8 E80700                  	call	_$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF	; Overflow occurred ?
 24194                                  					; then error, exit (without return here)
 24195 000019DB 46                      	inc	si			; update pointer
 24196 000019DC EBCD                    	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop
 24197                                  
 24198                                  _$P_Value_2x_OVF:
 24199 000019DE D1E2                    	shl	dx,1 			; to have 2*x
 24200 000019E0 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			; shift left w/ carry
 24201                                  _$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF:
 24202 000019E2 E89B00                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		; check overflow (for the last shift or add)
 24203 000019E5 7201                    	jc	short _$P_Value_OVF
 24204 000019E7 C3                      	retn
 24205                                  _$P_Value_OVF:
 24206 000019E8 44                      	inc	sp 			; skip "call" return address to the caller
 24207 000019E9 44                      	inc	sp
 24208                                  
 24209                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:	
 24210                                  %endif
 24211                                  ;****
 24212                                  
 24213                                  _$P_Value_Err0:				;AN000;
 24214 000019EA 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24215 000019EB E98300                  	jmp	_$P_Value_Err		;AN000; Bridge
 24216                                  ;

 24372                                  ;

 24379                                  _$P_Check_OVF:

 24383

 24385 00001A8A C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24386                                  
 24387                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24388 00001A8B 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24389 00001A8C 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24390                                  
 24391 00001A8E F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit

 24393

 24395 00001A90 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow

 24982 00001C9B 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 24983                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 24984 00001CA0 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24985 00001CA2 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 24986 00001CA4 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 24987                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24988 00001CA8 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 24989                                  	; 08/07/2023
 24990 00001CAB 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *
 24991 00001CAD 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 24992 00001CB1 740B                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 24993                                  	; 08/07/2023
 24994                                  	;;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 24995                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *
 24996 00001CB3 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; 
 24997                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 24998 00001CB6 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;

 25010 00001CC0 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;

 25012                                  
 25013                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25014                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25015                                  ;
 25016                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25017                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25018                                  ;	    blanks.
 25019                                  ;
 25020                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25021                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25022                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25023                                  ;
 25024                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25025                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25026                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25027                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25028                                  
 25029                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25030                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 25031                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 25032                                  
 25033                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25034 00001CC2 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25035 00001CC3 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25036 00001CC4 2EC606[F214]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25037                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25038                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25039 00001CCA 2E8026[F814]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25040 00001CD0 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25041 00001CD2 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25042                                  
 25043 00001CD4 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25044 00001CD6 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25045                                  
 25046 00001CD8 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25047 00001CDA 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25048                                  
 25049                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 25050                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 25051                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25052                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 25053                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 25054                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 25055                                  %if 0
 25056                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25057                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 25058                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 25059                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25060                                  
 25061                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 25062                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25063                                  
 25064                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 25065                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 25066                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 25067                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25068                                  %endif
 25069                                  
 25070                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 25071 00001CDC 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 25072                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 25073 00001CE1 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25074                                  
 25075                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 25076 00001CE3 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 25077                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 25078 00001CE5 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 25079                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25080                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 25081                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 25082                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25083 00001CE9 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 25084                                  
 25085 00001CEB BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 25086                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25087 00001CEE 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25088 00001CEF 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 25089 00001CF2 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25090                                  
 25091 00001CF4 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 25092                                  
 25093                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 25094                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 25095                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25096                                  	; cx=0 here
 25097 00001CF6 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 25098                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 25099                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 25100 00001CF7 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25101 00001CF8 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25102 00001CF9 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25103                                  
 25104                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 25105 00001CFA 2EA2[F214]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 25106 00001CFE 2EF606[F814]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 25107 00001D04 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 25108                                  
 25109 00001D06 2E800E[F814]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 25110                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 25111                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 25112 00001D0C 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 25113 00001D0E EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25114                                  
 25115                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25116                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25117                                  ;
 25118                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25119                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25120                                  ;
 25121                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25122                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25123                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25124                                  ;
 25125                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25126                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25127                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25128                                  
 25129                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25130                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25131                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25132                                  ;
 25133                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25134                                  
 25135                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25136                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25137                                  
 25138                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25139                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25140                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25141                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25142 00001D10 BD[0115]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25143                                  
 25144                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25145 00001D13 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25146 00001D15 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25147                                  
 25148                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25149 00001D17 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25150 00001D19 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25151                                  
 25152 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25153                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25154                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25155 00001D1C C3                      	retn
 25156                                  
 25157                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25158                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25159                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25160                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25161                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25162                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25163                                  
 25164                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25165                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25166 00001D1D 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25167 00001D1F 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25168                                  
 25169 00001D21 2E800E[F814]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25170                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25171                                  
 25172                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25173                                  	; cf=0
 25174                                  	;retn
 25175                                  
 25176                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25177                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25178                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25179 00001D27 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25180                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25181                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25182 00001D28 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25183                                  
 25184                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25185                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25186                                  ;
 25187                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25188                                  ;
 25189                                  ;  Input:
 25190                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25191                                  ;
 25192                                  ;  Output:
 25193                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25194                                  ;
 25195                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25196                                  ;
 25197                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25198                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25199                                  
 25200                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25201 00001D29 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25202 00001D2A 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25203 00001D2B 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25204                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25205                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25206                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25207 00001D2C 2E8B36[F514]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 25208 00001D31 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25209 00001D33 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25210 00001D35 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25211 00001D36 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25212 00001D37 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25213 00001D38 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25214 00001D39 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25215 00001D3A 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25216 00001D3B 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25217                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 25218                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25219 00001D3C 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25220 00001D3E B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25221 00001D41 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25222                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25223 00001D43 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25224 00001D45 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25225 00001D47 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25226 00001D48 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25227 00001D49 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25228 00001D4A 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25229 00001D4B 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25230 00001D4C 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25231 00001D4D 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25232 00001D4E 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25233                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25234 00001D50 2E8936[F314]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25235 00001D55 2E891E[F514]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25236                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25237                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25238                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25239                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25240 00001D5A 2EC536[F314]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25241                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25242 00001D5F 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25243 00001D62 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25244 00001D64 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25245 00001D66 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25246 00001D68 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25247 00001D6B 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25248 00001D6D F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25249 00001D6E EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25250                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25251 00001D70 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25252 00001D71 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25253                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25254 00001D72 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25255                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25256                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25257                                  	; cf=0
 25258                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25259                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25260 00001D74 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25261 00001D75 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25262 00001D76 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25263 00001D77 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25824                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25825                                  
 25826                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25827                                  
 25828                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25829                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25830                                  
 25831                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25832                                  ;
 25833                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25834                                  ;
 25835                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25836                                  ;
 25837                                  ;   Modification log:
 25838                                  ;
 25839                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25840                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25841                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25842                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25843                                  ;
 25844                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25845                                  ;
 25846                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25847                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25848                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25849                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25850                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25851                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25852                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25853                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25854                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25855                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25856                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25857                                  ;
 25858                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25859                                  
 25860                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25861                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25862                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25863                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25864                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25865                                  
 25866                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25867                                  
 25868                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25869                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25870                                  
 25871                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25872                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25873                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25874                                  
 25875                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25876                                  ;
 25877                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25878                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25879                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25880                                  ;	           line.
 25881                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25882                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25883                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25884                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25885                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25886                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25887                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25888                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25889                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25890                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25891                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25892                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25893                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25894                                  ;	           for details).
 25895                                  
 25896 00001F77 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 25897 00001F78 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 25898 00001F79 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 25899 00001F7B 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 25900 00001F7C 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25901 00001F8C 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25902 00001FAC 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 25903 00001FAD 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 25904 00001FAE 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 25905                                  
 25906                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25907                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25908                                  
 25909                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25910                                  
 25911                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022

 26029 00002025 E842F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26030 00002028 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26031                                  
 26032                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26033                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26034                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26035                                  ;
 26036                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26037                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26038                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26039                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26040                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26041                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26042                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26043                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26044                                  ;
 26045 0000202A 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26046 0000202B 8916[DD14]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for

 26054 00002038 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx

 26063                                   
 26064 0000203C 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 26065 0000203E 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 26066                                  
 26067 00002040 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26068 00002042 2E8B0E[5603]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 26069 00002047 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 26070                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh

 26074                                  
 26075                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 26076                                  
 26077 0000204D 50                      	push	ax
 26078 0000204E 57                      	push	di
 26079 0000204F 51                      	push	cx

 26081 00002052 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer

 26084 00002058 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 26085                                  
 26086                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 26087                                  
 26088 0000205A 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah

 26091                                  
 26092                                  puteol:
 26093 0000205B B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 26094 0000205D AA                      	stosb
 26095 0000205E B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 26096 00002060 AA                      	stosb
 26097 00002061 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 26098                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26099                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 26100                                  
 26101                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 26102                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26103 00002063 0E                      	push	cs
 26104 00002064 1F                      	pop	ds
 26105                                  
 26106 00002065 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 26107                                  
 26108 00002069 59                      	pop	cx
 26109 0000206A 5F                      	pop	di
 26110 0000206B 58                      	pop	ax
 26111                                  
 26112                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26113                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26114                                  	;push	cs
 26115                                  	;pop	ds
 26116                                  
 26117 0000206C 50                      	push	ax
 26118                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 26119 0000206D B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 26120 0000206F CD21                    	int	21h
 26121 00002071 58                      	pop	ax
 26122 00002072 9D                      	popf
 26123 00002073 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 26124 00002075 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 26125 00002077 742D                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 26126                                  conferr:
 26127 00002079 BA[FC45]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 26128 0000207C E8D324                  	call	badfil
 26129                                  ;endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 26130 0000207F C3                      	retn
 26131                                  
 26132                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26133                                  ;
 26134                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 26135                                  ;
 26136                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
