 26139                                  
 26140                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26141                                  multi_pass:
 26142 00002080 0E                      	push	cs
 26143 00002081 1F                      	pop	ds
 26144                                  
 26145 00002082 803E[CD02]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 26146                                  ;jae_endconv:
 26147 00002087 731C                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 26148                                  
 26149                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26150 00002089 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]
 26151                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26152                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26153 0000208D 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 26154                                  
 26155 0000208E 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 26156 00002092 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 26157 00002096 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 26158 00002098 8936[5A03]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 26159 0000209C 8936[AF02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 26160                                  
 26161 000020A0 E8F408                  	call	getchr
 26162 000020A3 EB07                    	jmp	short conflp
 26163                                  
 26164                                  	; 01/01/2023
 26165                                  endconv:
 26166 000020A5 C3                      	retn	
 26167                                  
 26168                                  getcom:
 26169                                  	; 03/01/2023
 26170                                  	; ds = cs
 26171 000020A6 E84E16                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 26172 000020A9 E8EB08                  	call	getchr
 26173                                  conflp: 
 26174 000020AC 72F7                    	jc	short endconv
 26175                                  
 26176 000020AE FF06[AF02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26177                                  
 26178 000020B2 C606[E114]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26179 000020B7 C606[E414]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26180 000020BC 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26181 000020BE 7449                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26182                                  
 26183                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26184                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 26185                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26186                                  ;%if 0
 26187                                  
 26188                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26189                                  
 26190                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26191                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26192                                  
 26193 000020C0 A2[DF14]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26194                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26195 000020C3 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26196 000020C5 803E[E014]00                    cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26197 000020CA 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26198                                  
 26199 000020CC 50                              push    ax                      ;
 26200 000020CD E8C708                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26201 000020D0 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26202 000020D2 E8C208                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26203 000020D5 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26204 000020D7 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26205 000020DA 58                              pop     ax
 26206                                  ;
 26207                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26208                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26209                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26210                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26211                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26212                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26213                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26214                                  ;   spot.
 26215                                  ;
 26216                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26217                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26218                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26219                                  ;   retrieved.
 26220                                  ;
 26221 000020DB 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26222 000020E0 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 26223                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26224 000020E2 F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26225 000020E7 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26226 000020E9 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26227 000020EE 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 26228                                  final:                                  ;
 26229 000020F0 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26230                                  not_final:                              ;
 26231                                  ;endif
 26232                                  
 26233                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26234                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26235                                  
 26236 000020F3 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26237 000020F5 E89F08                  	call	getchr
 26238 000020F8 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26239                                  
 26240 000020FA 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26241                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26242                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26243 000020FF 73A4                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26244 00002101 E95F08                  	jmp	badop
 26245                                  	
 26246                                  coff:	
 26247                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26248                                  	; ds = cs
 26249                                  	;push	cs
 26250                                  	;pop	ds
 26251 00002104 E8CB21                  	call	newline
 26252 00002107 EBA3                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 26253                                  
 26254                                  blank_line:
 26255 00002109 E88B08                  	call	getchr
 26256 0000210C EB9E                    	jmp	short conflp
 26257                                  
 26258                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26259                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26260                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26261                                  ;coff_p:
 26262                                  	;push	cs
 26263                                  	;pop	ds
 26264                                  
 26265                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26266                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26267                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26268                                  ;install= command.
 26269                                  
 26270                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26271                                  ;install command
 26272                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26273                                  
 26274                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26275                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26276                                  tryi:
 26277 0000210E 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26278 00002113 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26279 00002115 E97F01                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26280                                  not_init_pass:
 26281 00002118 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 26282                                          ; 11/12/2022
 26283                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 26284 0000211D 74E5                    	je	short coff
 26285                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26286                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26287                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 26288                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 26289                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 26290                                  					; and before install= commands
 26291                                  					; are processed
 26292                                  
 26293 0000211F 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 26294 00002124 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 26295 00002126 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26296                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26297                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 26298 00002129 74D9                    	je	short coff
 26299                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26300                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26301                                  
 26302                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 26303                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26304                                          
 26305 0000212B 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 26306                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26307 0000212E 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 26308                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26309                                  	;jne	short tryb	
 26310                                  	
 26311                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 26312 00002130 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26313                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 26314 00002135 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26315                                  
 26316                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26317                                  ; (SYSINIT:2448h)
 26318                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26319                                  ;%if 0
 26320                                  precheck_installhigh:
 26321 00002137 80FC57                  	cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 26322 0000213A 756B                    	jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 26323                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26324 0000213C 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26325 00002141 EBC1                    	jmp	short coff
 26326                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26327                                  
 26328                                  multi_try_i:
 26329 00002143 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?

 27197                                  skip_pass_limit:
 27198                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 27199                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 27200                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 27201                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 27202                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 27203                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 27204                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.
 27205                                  ;
 27206                                  ;	Note that this will make it impossible for this device
 27207                                  ;	driver to access the DblSpace drive letters, whether
 27208                                  ;	they are swapped-hosts or unswapped compressed drives,
 27209                                  ;	during its initialization phase.
 27210                                  
 27211                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27212                                  ; (SYSINIT:2752h)

 27215                                  	; 31/12/2022

 27219                                  	; 31/12/2022

 27222                                  
 27223 000023F6 2EA0[8003]              	mov	al,[cs:drivenumber]	; temporarily use this next drv value

 28129                                  trypbad:
 28130 0000273B E92502                  	jmp	badop
 28131                                  
 28132                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28133                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28134                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28135                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28136                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28137                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28138                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28139                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28140                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28141                                  
 28142                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28143                                  ;									  *
 28144                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28145                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28146                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28147                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28148                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28149                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28150                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28151                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28152                                  ; input :								  *
 28153                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28154                                  ; output:								  *
 28155                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28156                                  ;									  *
 28157                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28158                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28159                                  ; logic:								  *
 28160                                  ; {									  *
 28161                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28162                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28163                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28164                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28165                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28166                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28167                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28168                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28169                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28170                                  ;	     }								  *
 28171                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28172                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28173                                  ;	};								  *
 28174                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28175                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28176                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28177                                  ; };									  *
 28178                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28179                                  
 28180                                  tryk:
 28181                                          ;if      stacksw
 28182                                  
 28183 0000273E 80FC4B                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_STACKS ; 'K'
 28184 00002741 7402                    	je	short do_tryk
 28185                                  skip_it4:
 28186 00002743 EB79                    	jmp	short trys	; 15/12/2022

 28189                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 28217 0000275F 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?

 28220                                  	; 14/12/2022
 28221                                  	; ds = cs
 28222                                  
 28223                                  	;;mov	ax,[cs:rv_dword]

 28656                                  ;								       *

 28917                                  sysinit_parse:
 28918                                  
 28919                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28920                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28921                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28922                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28923                                  ;
 28924                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28925                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28926                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28927                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28928                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28929                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28930                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28931                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28932                                  ;	 procedure.
 28933                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28934                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28935                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28936                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28937                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 28938                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28939                                  
 28940                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28941                                  	; (SYSINIT:2D78h)
 28942                                  
 28943                                  	; 24/10/2022

 28949

 28952

 29157                                  ; and display showcount at the current curser position.

 29181 000029BB B90A00                  	mov	cx,10		; decimal divide factor

 29184 000029BE A1[AF02]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 29185                                  sln_loop:

 29187 000029C1 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; < 10 ?
 29188                                  	;cmp	ax,10		; < 10?

 29192 000029C7 F7F1                    	div	cx	; cx = 10

 29197

 29213                                  ;
 29214                                  ; procedure : ProcDOS
 29215                                  ;
 29216                                  ;	Process the result of DOS= parsing
 29217                                  ;
 29218                                  ;	result_val._$P_item_tag	= 1 for DOS=HIGH
 29219                                  ;				= 2 for DOS=LOW
 29220                                  ;				= 3 for DOS=UMB
 29221                                  ;				= 4 for DOS=NOUMB
 29222                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29223                                  
 29224                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modififed MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 29225                                  	; (SYTSINIT:2AB5h)
 29226                                  ProcDOS:
 29227                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29228                                  	; ds = cs
 29229 000029DD 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 29230                                  	;;mov	al,[cs:result_val_itag]
 29231                                  	;mov	al,[cs:result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag]
 29232                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29233 000029DF A0[C21D]                	mov	al,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag]
 29234 000029E2 48                      	dec	ax
 29235 000029E3 7415                    	jz	short pd_hi
 29236 000029E5 48                      	dec	ax
 29237 000029E6 740E                    	jz	short pd_lo
 29238 000029E8 48                      	dec	ax
 29239 000029E9 7405                    	jz	short pd_umb
 29240                                  	;;mov	byte [cs:DevUMB],0
 29241                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29242                                  	;mov	byte [cs:DevUMB],ah ; 0
 29243                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29244 000029EB 8826[BE1F]              	mov	byte [DevUMB],ah ; 0
 29245 000029EF C3                      	retn
 29246                                  pd_umb:
 29247                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29248 000029F0 C606[BE1F]FF            	mov	byte [DevUMB],0FFh
 29249                                  	;mov	byte [cs:DevUMB],0FFh
 29250 000029F5 C3                      	retn
 29251                                  pd_lo:
 29252                                  	; 01/01/2023

 29254                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29255                                  	;mov	[cs:runhigh],al ; 0

 29265                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29266                                  ;
 29267                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29268                                  ;
 29269                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29270                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29271                                  ;
 29272                                  ;	Output : none
 29273                                  ;
 29274                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29275                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29276                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29277                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29278                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29279                                  ;
 29280                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29281                                  
 29282                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29283                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29284                                  	; ds = cs
 29285 00002A00 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29286                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 29287                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29288 00002A03 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29289 00002A06 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29290                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29291                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29292                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29293                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29294                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29295                                  	; ds = cs
 29296 00002A08 803E[CD1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29297 00002A0D 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29298 00002A0F A1[B31F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29299                                  lim_set:
 29300                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29301                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29302                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29303                                  ;limx:
 29304                                  	;retn
 29305                                  	
 29306                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29307                                  
 29308                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29309                                  ;
 29310                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29311                                  ;
 29312                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29313                                  ;	Output : none
 29314                                  ;
 29315                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29316                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29317                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29318                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29319                                  ;
 29320                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29321                                  
 29322                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29323                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29324 00002A12 1E                      	push	ds
 29325 00002A13 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29326 00002A16 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29327 00002A18 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29328 00002A1C 2E891E[D11F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29329 00002A21 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29330 00002A23 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29331 00002A25 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29332 00002A28 2EC606[D01F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29333 00002A2E 1F                      	pop	ds
 29334                                  ;limx:
 29335 00002A2F C3                      	retn
 29336                                  
 29337                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29338                                  ;
 29339                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29340                                  ;
 29341                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29342                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29343                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29344                                  ;
 29345                                  ;	Output : none
 29346                                  ;
 29347                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29348                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29349                                  ;
 29350                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29351                                  
 29352                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29353                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29354                                  	; ds = cs
 29355 00002A30 803E[D01F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29356                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29357                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29358                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29359 00002A35 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29360                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29361 00002A37 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29362 00002A3A 8826[D01F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29363                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29364                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29365 00002A3E 1E                      	push	ds
 29366                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29367 00002A3F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29368 00002A41 2EA1[D11F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29369 00002A45 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29370 00002A48 1F                      	pop	ds
 29371                                  timx:
 29372 00002A49 C3                      	retn

 29399 00002A5E 5E                      	pop	si

 29425                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29426                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 29427                                  
 29428                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29429                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29430                                  
 29431                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29432                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29433                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29434                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29435                                  
 29436                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29437                                  ;
 29438                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29439                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29440                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29441                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29442                                  ;
 29443                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29444                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29445                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29446                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29447                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29448                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29449                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29450                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29451                                  ; available during the load.
 29452                                  ;
 29453                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29454                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29455                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29456                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29457                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29458                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29459                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29460                                  ;
 29461                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29462                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29463                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29464                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29465                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29466                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29467                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29468                                  ;
 29469                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29470                                  
 29471                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29472                                  
 29473                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29474                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29475                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29476                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29477                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29478                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29479                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29480                                  
 29481                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29482                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29483                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29484                                  
 29485                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29486                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29487                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29488                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29489                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29490                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29491                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29492                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29493                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 29494                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29495                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29496                                  
 29497                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29498                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 29499                                  
 29500                                  InitVar:
 29501                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29502                                  	; ds = cs
 29503                                  
 29504                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29505                                  	; 03/01/2023
 29506                                  	;push	ax
 29507                                  	;push	cx
 29508                                  	;push	di
 29509 00002A74 06                      	push	es
 29510                                  
 29511                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29512 00002A75 0E                      	push	cs
 29513 00002A76 07                      	pop	es
 29514                                  
 29515 00002A77 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 29516                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29517                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29518                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29519                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29520                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29521                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29522                                  
 29523                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29524                                  	; ds = cs
 29525 00002A79 A2[781F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29526 00002A7C A2[771F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29527 00002A7F A3[791F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29528 00002A82 C606[7B1F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29529                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29530 00002A87 A2[AE1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 29531                                  
 29532 00002A8A FC                      	cld
 29533                                  
 29534 00002A8B B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29535 00002A8E BF[7C1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29536 00002A91 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29537                                  
 29538                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29539                                  	; 01/01/2033
 29540 00002A93 B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 29541 00002A95 BF[8C1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29542 00002A98 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29543                                  
 29544                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29545                                  
 29546                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29547 00002A9A 07                      	pop	es
 29548                                  	; 03/01/2023
 29549                                  	;pop	di
 29550                                  	;pop	cx
 29551                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 29552                                  
 29553 00002A9B C3                      	retn
 29554                                  
 29555                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29556                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29557                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29558                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29559                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29560                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29561                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29562                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29563                                  
 29564                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29565                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 29566                                  FixMem:
 29567                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29568                                  	;push	ax
 29569                                  	;push	bx
 29570                                  	;push	cx
 29571                                  	;push	dx
 29572 00002A9C 06                      	push	es
 29573                                  
 29574 00002A9D E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29575                                  
 29576 00002AA0 E80C02                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29577 00002AA3 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29578                                  
 29579 00002AA5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29580                                  
 29581                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29582                                  
 29583 00002AA7 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29584 00002AA9 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29585 00002AAB 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29586                                  
 29587                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29588                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29589                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29590                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29591                                  
 29592 00002AAC 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29593 00002AB0 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29594 00002AB5 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29595 00002AB7 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29596                                  
 29597                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29598                                  
 29599 00002AB9 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29600 00002ABE 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29601 00002AC0 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29602                                  
 29603 00002AC4 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29604                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29605                                  	; 11/07/2023
 29606 00002AC9 43                      	inc	bx
 29607 00002ACA 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29608                                  
 29609                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29610                                  
 29611 00002ACF 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29612 00002AD1 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29613                                  
 29614 00002AD6 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29615 00002AD8 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29616 00002ADD 43                      	inc	bx
 29617 00002ADE 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 29618                                  
 29619                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29620 00002AE0 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29621 00002AE2 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29622                                  fmX:	
 29623 00002AE4 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29624                                  
 29625 00002AE7 07                      	pop	es
 29626                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29627                                  	;pop	dx
 29628                                  	;pop	cx
 29629                                  	;pop	bx
 29630                                  	;pop	ax
 29631                                  
 29632 00002AE8 C3                      	retn
 29633                                  
 29634                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29635                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29636                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29637                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29638                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29639                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29640                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29641                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29642                                  
 29643                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 29644                                  fm_link:
 29645 00002AE9 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29646 00002AEC CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29647                                  
 29648                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29649                                  	;
 29650                                  	;push	es
 29651                                  	;push	cs
 29652                                  	;pop	es
 29653                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29654                                  	;pop	es
 29655                                  	
 29656                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29657                                  	; ds = cs
 29658                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29659 00002AEE A2[AC1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 29660                                  
 29661 00002AF1 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29662 00002AF4 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 29663 00002AF7 CD21                    	int	21h
 29664 00002AF9 C3                      	retn
 29665                                  
 29666                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29667                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29668                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29669                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29670                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29671                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29672                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29673                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29674                                  
 29675                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 29676                                  fm_unlink:
 29677 00002AFA 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 29678                                  	
 29679                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29680                                  	;
 29681                                  	;push	ds
 29682                                  	;push	cs
 29683                                  	;pop	ds
 29684                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29685                                  	;pop	ds
 29686                                  	
 29687                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29688                                  	; ds = cs
 29689                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29690 00002AFC 8A1E[AC1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 29691                                  
 29692 00002B00 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29693 00002B03 CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29694 00002B05 C3                      	retn
 29695                                  
 29696                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29697                                  
 29698                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29699                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29700                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29701                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29702                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29703                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29704                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29705                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29706                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29707                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29708                                  ;
 29709                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29710                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29711                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29712                                  ;
 29713                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29714                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29715                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29716                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29717                                  ;
 29718                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29719                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29720                                  ;
 29721                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29722                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29723                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29724                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29725                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29726                                  ;     lh
 29727                                  ;     /l
 29728                                  ;     1
 29729                                  ;     1000
 29730                                  ;     2
 29731                                  ;     print
 29732                                  ;     /d
 29733                                  ;     :lpt2
 29734                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29735                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29736                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29737                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29738                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29739                                  ; for:
 29740                                  ;    Each /L
 29741                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29742                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29743                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29744                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29745                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29746                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29747                                  
 29748                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29749                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 29750                                  
 29751                                  ParseVar:
 29752                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29753                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29754                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 29755 00002B06 1E                      	push	ds
 29756 00002B07 06                      	push	es
 29757                                  
 29758 00002B08 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29759 00002B09 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29760 00002B0A FC                      	cld
 29761                                  
 29762                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29763                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29764                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29765                                  
 29766 00002B0B AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29767 00002B0C E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 29768 00002B0F 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29769                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29770 00002B11 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29771 00002B13 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29772                                  
 29773 00002B15 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29774 00002B16 F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29775 00002B17 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29776                                  
 29777 00002B19 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29778                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29779 00002B1A 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 29780                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29781 00002B1C 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29782 00002B1E 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 29783                                  
 29784                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29785 00002B20 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29786                                  
 29787                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29788                                  	;
 29789                                  	;push	es
 29790                                  	;push	cs
 29791                                  	;pop	es
 29792                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29793                                  	;pop	es
 29794                                  
 29795 00002B25 2EC606[781F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29796                                  
 29797 00002B2B EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29798                                  
 29799                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29800 00002B2D 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29801 00002B2F 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29802                                  
 29803                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29804 00002B31 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29805                                  
 29806 00002B36 E80E00                  	call	parseL
 29807 00002B39 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29808                                  
 29809 00002B3B 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29810 00002B3C EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29811                                  
 29812                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29813 00002B3E B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29814 00002B41 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 29815 00002B42 4E                      	dec	si
 29816 00002B43 F9                      	stc
 29817                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29818 00002B44 07                      	pop	es
 29819 00002B45 1F                      	pop	ds
 29820                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29821                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 29822 00002B46 C3                      	retn
 29823                                  
 29824                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29825                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29826                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29827                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29828                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29829                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29830                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29831                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29832                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29833                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29834                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29835                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29836                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29837                                  
 29838                                  parseL:
 29839 00002B47 AC                      	lodsb
 29840 00002B48 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29841 00002B4A 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29842                                  
 29843                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29844                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29845                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29846                                  
 29847 00002B4C E8E700                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29848 00002B4F 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29849 00002B51 E8A901                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29850                                  
 29851 00002B54 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29852 00002B56 E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29853 00002B59 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29854                                  
 29855                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29856 00002B5B 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29857                                  
 29858 00002B60 AC                      	lodsb
 29859 00002B61 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29860 00002B63 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29861                                  
 29862 00002B65 E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29863 00002B68 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29864                                  
 29865 00002B6A E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29866 00002B6D 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29867                                  
 29868                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29869 00002B6F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29870 00002B71 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29871                                  
 29872 00002B73 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29873 00002B75 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29874                                  
 29875                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29876                                  
 29877 00002B77 E8BC00                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29878 00002B7A 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29879                                  
 29880 00002B7C E82201                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29881                                  
 29882 00002B7F E87200                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29883                                  
 29884                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29885 00002B82 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29886                                  
 29887 00002B87 AC                      	lodsb
 29888 00002B88 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29889 00002B8A 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 29890                                  
 29891 00002B8C E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29892 00002B8F 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29893                                  
 29894 00002B91 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29895 00002B94 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29896                                  
 29897                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29898 00002B96 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29899 00002B98 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29900                                  plE1:	
 29901                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29902 00002B9A B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29903 00002B9D 4E                      	dec	si
 29904 00002B9E F9                      	stc
 29905 00002B9F C3                      	retn
 29906                                  
 29907                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29908 00002BA0 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29909                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29910                                  	; cf=1
 29911                                  	;stc
 29912 00002BA3 C3                      	retn
 29913                                  plSwX:	
 29914 00002BA4 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29915                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29916                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29917                                  	; cf=0
 29918                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29919 00002BA5 C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29920

 29946                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29947                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29948                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29949                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29950                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29951                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29952                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29953                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29954                                  
 29955                                  isEOL:
 29956 00002BA6 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29957 00002BA8 7406                    	je	short ieX
 29958 00002BAA 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29959 00002BAC 7402                    	je	short ieX
 29960 00002BAE 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29961                                  ieX:	
 29962 00002BB0 C3                      	retn
 29963                                  
 29964                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29965                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29966                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29967                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29968                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29969                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29970                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29971                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29972                                  
 29973                                  isWhite:
 29974 00002BB1 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29975 00002BB3 7406                    	je	short iwX
 29976 00002BB5 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29977 00002BB7 7402                    	je	short iwX
 29978 00002BB9 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29979                                  iwX:	
 29980 00002BBB C3                      	retn

 30033                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30034                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 30035                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 30036                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 30037                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 30038                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30039                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 30040                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30041                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 30042                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30043                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30044                                  
 30045                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30046                                  stowUMB:
 30047 00002BCF 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 30048 00002BD1 7202                    	jb	short su10
 30049 00002BD3 F9                      	stc
 30050 00002BD4 C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 30051                                  su10:	
 30052                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30053                                  	;push	bx
 30054                                  	;push	di
 30055                                  	;push	si
 30056                                  	;push	ds
 30057                                  	;push	es
 30058                                  	;push	cs
 30059                                  	;pop	es
 30060                                  	;push	cs
 30061                                  	;pop	ds
 30062                                  
 30063                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30064                                  	; ds <> cs
 30065                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 30066 00002BD5 2E803E[7B1F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 30067                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 30068 00002BDB 7504                    	jne	short su20
 30069 00002BDD 2EA2[7B1F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 30070                                  
 30071                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 30072                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 30073                                  	;jne	short su20
 30074                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 30075                                  su20:	
 30076 00002BE1 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 30077 00002BE3 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 30078                                  
 30079                                  	;mov	bl,al
 30080                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 30081                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 30082                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30083 00002BE5 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 30084 00002BE7 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 30085 00002BE9 B001                    	mov	al,1
 30086                                  
 30087                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 30088                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30089 00002BEB 2E8687[7C1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 30090                                  
 30091                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 30092                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 30093                                  	;
 30094                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 30095                                  	
 30096                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30097 00002BF0 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 30098 00002BF2 F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 30099                                  su30:	
 30100                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30101                                  	;pop	es
 30102                                  	;pop	ds
 30103                                  	;pop	si
 30104                                  	;pop	di
 30105                                  	;pop	bx
 30106 00002BF3 C3                      	retn
 30107                                  
 30108                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30109                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 30110                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30111                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 30112                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30113                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30114                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30115                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30116                                  
 30117                                  ; 13/05/2019
 30118                                  
 30119                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30120                                  stowSiz:
 30121                                  	; 01/01/2023

 30123                                  	;;push	di ; ?
 30124                                  	;push	es
 30125                                  
 30126                                  	;push	cs
 30127                                  	;pop	es	
 30128                                  
 30129 00002BF4 88CB                    	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 30130 00002BF6 B700                    	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 30131 00002BF8 D0E3                    	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 30132                                  	;mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 30133                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30134 00002BFA 2E8987[8C1F]            	mov	[cs:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 30135                                  
 30136                                  	; 01/01/2023
